commit_message:
Fix tar command path for magnum conductor using ubuntu

In ubuntu, the tar binary path is /bin/tar instead of /usr/bin/tar.
Change to use tar directly for all os.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I12562d3ac186acab651ffae715e5c7788cd98b7e

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-14 05:35:54.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Neutron is refactoring a lot of its code. For example, common entities
are being moved to neutron-lib. When code is refactored it is marked
with debtcollector, which issues a deprecation warning. In the next
release the old entity will be removed. Consuming projects (like
tricircle) must update to comply with the new entity before the old
one is removed.

Tricircle maintainers must monitor deprecation warnings and act on them
before the next release.

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Iade909b35a55cebb7dfe13a688f451ad91989b94
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Neutron is refactoring a lot of its code. For example, common entities
are being moved to neutron-lib. When code is refactored it is marked
with debtcollector, which issues a deprecation warning. In the next
release the old entity will be removed. Consuming projects (like
tricircle) must update to comply with the new entity before the old
one is removed.

Tricircle maintainers must monitor deprecation warnings and act on them
before the next release.

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Iade909b35a55cebb7dfe13a688f451ad91989b94

commit_message:
Remove '--config' option when create/update a vim

When create/update a vim, only enable '--config-file' option, will
remove '--config' option.

Change-Id: I8a728134ce0229db98de10bff5f4f46e7f2a9f2c
Closes-bug: #1587216

subject: Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-18 01:37:19.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': 'Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: If909bfc3696619d16ba87591c4e6a831f63f20ff
'}]
commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: If909bfc3696619d16ba87591c4e6a831f63f20ff

subject: Fix node join behavior
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 08:23:00.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_node.py', 'senlin/engine/node.py'], 'message': 'Fix node join behavior

When adding a node to a cluster, we need to set the node index before
updating the backend physical resource. In this way, the backend
resource (e.g. a nova server) can always get a reasonable index value.
This is a preparation for updating server metadata properly.

Change-Id: Ic25d5655bf823b35280adfb870784a49289d3c88
'}]
commit_message:
Fix node join behavior

When adding a node to a cluster, we need to set the node index before
updating the backend physical resource. In this way, the backend
resource (e.g. a nova server) can always get a reasonable index value.
This is a preparation for updating server metadata properly.

Change-Id: Ic25d5655bf823b35280adfb870784a49289d3c88

commit_message:
Don't fail if switch is not found

This patch allows to do not fail immediately if switch is not found in
genericswitch devices. It allows neutron to use other ML2 drivers/agents
try to bind port.

Change-Id: If03a5c7f6cbad00bac297abea10bfd9707cbee46

commit_message:
Volume migration progress

This patch proposes the following changes:
* Get the volume migration progress for one volume.
This is an admin only action, make it possible for the
admin to check the migration progress.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Partial-implements: blueprint migration-improvement
Change-Id: I5a1a717d1d08f550b45836d958a51f1f3fba5eed

commit_message:
Return backup parent_id when list/show backups

Currently, when the details of a backup are returned when the list
backups or show backup commands are called, the parent_id is
not included. This patch adds the parent_id to the data being
returned.

This patch will make us known the dependency relationship
between a volume's backups easier.

The parent_id also help horizon or other openstack portal
to draw the backups relationship graph.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I575748cd12416dab45f1b7b46fa5454d6521578a
Implements: blueprint list-backups-return-parent-id

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-01-20 15:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/privileged/mount.py', 'requirements.txt', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py', 'os_brick/remotefs/remotefs.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connector.py', 'etc/os-brick/rootwrap.d/os-brick.filters', 'os_brick/privileged/__init__.py'], 'message': "Migrate remotefs from rootwrap to privsep

This is an initial change to introduce oslo.privsep.  As an example test
candidate, this change also migrates remotefs from rootwrap to privsep.

Since privsep works around python function calls rather than rootwrap's
command lines, the migration is not a simple substition.  The approach
taken here is that all privileged command lines are built on the
privileged side from meaningful arguments that can be verified
separately.

In addition, it is expected that a paranoid deployment of this change
will run the privileged process as a non-root uid, with CAP_SYS_ADMIN.
This non-root uid will need to be able to write to relevant filesystem
locations (eg: /etc/pstorage/clusters/ if using vzstorage), but it means
zero use of uid=0 or sudo, and file operations can be performed in
natural python rather than execing chown, tee, etc.

Depends-On: I9e44952ba83abccd7130fd01a9acbb09520fdb38
Change-Id: Iec56ead6d12a018fbf848d518184ba3ef3d45e9e
Implements: blueprint privsep
"}]
commit_message:
Migrate remotefs from rootwrap to privsep

This is an initial change to introduce oslo.privsep.  As an example test
candidate, this change also migrates remotefs from rootwrap to privsep.

Since privsep works around python function calls rather than rootwrap's
command lines, the migration is not a simple substition.  The approach
taken here is that all privileged command lines are built on the
privileged side from meaningful arguments that can be verified
separately.

In addition, it is expected that a paranoid deployment of this change
will run the privileged process as a non-root uid, with CAP_SYS_ADMIN.
This non-root uid will need to be able to write to relevant filesystem
locations (eg: /etc/pstorage/clusters/ if using vzstorage), but it means
zero use of uid=0 or sudo, and file operations can be performed in
natural python rather than execing chown, tee, etc.

Depends-On: I9e44952ba83abccd7130fd01a9acbb09520fdb38
Change-Id: Iec56ead6d12a018fbf848d518184ba3ef3d45e9e
Implements: blueprint privsep

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-01-22 06:49:44.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/utils.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_actions.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/volume_actions.py'], 'message': "Don't call remove_export with attachments left

This patch changes how Cinder responds to detach calls
for volumes that are attached to multiple VMs on a single host.

When multi-attach is enabled and a single volume is attached to
multiple vms on a single host, we don't want to call the driver's
remove_export as this will most likely remove the target and cause
failures for the remaining attachments.

Change-Id: I292304b1aa76d7cb7e04731fd0ecb902428ea224
Closes-Bug: #1471278
"}]
commit_message:
Don't call remove_export with attachments left

This patch changes how Cinder responds to detach calls
for volumes that are attached to multiple VMs on a single host.

When multi-attach is enabled and a single volume is attached to
multiple vms on a single host, we don't want to call the driver's
remove_export as this will most likely remove the target and cause
failures for the remaining attachments.

Change-Id: I292304b1aa76d7cb7e04731fd0ecb902428ea224
Closes-Bug: #1471278

commit_message:
Update test cases related to attach_volume
and detach_volume API

The following patch updates test cases related to
attach_volume and detach_volume API with volume
versionedobjects in cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py
file.

We want to update both the attach_volume()
and detach_volume() with versionedobjects.
There are 3 patches in the chain.

The patch sequence is:
- Update attach_volume() with versionedojbects
- Update detach_volume() with versionedobjects
- Update test cases related to attach_volume
  and detach_volume in file
  cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py

Co-Authored-By: Thang Pham <thang.g.pham@gmail.com>
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

Change-Id: I354de08b92a9d5515f354d19960b80ded530a8a8

commit_message:
Use magic constants instead of magic numbers

It's a best practice to use magic constants instead of
magic numbers. So, this patch tried to introduce the
HTTP status codes unified by the httplib to replace
the direct hard code.

Change-Id: Id00d15a331826b79e14bdce0ea7fc60e482da818

commit_message:
Add judgement of backing-up volume status

Backing up in-use glusterfs volume, in fact it create
snapshot and then copy volume from snapshot to achieve
backup.And now the volume status will change to backing-up.

Backup will call _create_cloned_volume function in remotefs.py,
But _create_cloned_volume func lack judgement of backing-up
status.

Change-Id: I1e86ca42a8eb406653e3916f67c9e3337e6d9ffd
Closes-Bug: #1553447

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-03 08:30:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/datastore.py'], 'message': "Improve the time cost for datastore selection in cinder vmdk driver

The current datastore selection method in cinder vmdk driver is: get
all the hosts, then iterate over all the datastores of the hosts, this
needs API calls to get datastores of each host, when an adequate
datastore is selected, the loop and selection process will terminate.
If no datastore meets the requirement, it will iterate over all the
hosts.

So if there are many hosts in the environment, and the top hosts in
the host list don't meet the requirement, openstack will keep
iterating and interactiving with the next host, the result is
openstack interactives too much times with vcenter(api calls).
If the user is going to do an operation, for example: create a volume,
it will be very slow to create a volume, it's an potential
performance problem.

Through investigation, the time cost mainly focuses on datastore
selection phase, so this commit aims to improve the performance
problem during datastore selection.

Change-Id: I774ae2b2f1a94aff49a2ac47e2b536379d5e73af
Closes-Bug: #1521894
"}]
commit_message:
Improve the time cost for datastore selection in cinder vmdk driver

The current datastore selection method in cinder vmdk driver is: get
all the hosts, then iterate over all the datastores of the hosts, this
needs API calls to get datastores of each host, when an adequate
datastore is selected, the loop and selection process will terminate.
If no datastore meets the requirement, it will iterate over all the
hosts.

So if there are many hosts in the environment, and the top hosts in
the host list don't meet the requirement, openstack will keep
iterating and interactiving with the next host, the result is
openstack interactives too much times with vcenter(api calls).
If the user is going to do an operation, for example: create a volume,
it will be very slow to create a volume, it's an potential
performance problem.

Through investigation, the time cost mainly focuses on datastore
selection phase, so this commit aims to improve the performance
problem during datastore selection.

Change-Id: I774ae2b2f1a94aff49a2ac47e2b536379d5e73af
Closes-Bug: #1521894

commit_message:
Add pagination support to cgsnapshots

In liberty release, we have added pagination to backups
and snapshots. There are still some work that hasn't been
done yet.
This patch adds pagination support to cgsnapshots.

APIImpact
Add pagination args like limit, marker, sort to query
cgsnapshots.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I84e0b8bce744d036c435fb57c29889ba3a605b90
Implements: blueprint add-pagination-to-other-resource

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-25 14:19:20.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_sheepdog.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/sheepdog.py'], 'message': "Sheepdog: Improve copy_volume_to_image method

Since cinder has provided image_utils.convert_image() method to
convert image, I think it's better to use this method instead of
run qemu-img command directly.

Change-Id: I16bc9a2b3666a080710c335bb9ed843e9cd91d8f
"}]
commit_message:
Sheepdog: Improve copy_volume_to_image method

Since cinder has provided image_utils.convert_image() method to
convert image, I think it's better to use this method instead of
run qemu-img command directly.

Change-Id: I16bc9a2b3666a080710c335bb9ed843e9cd91d8f

subject: Wrong usage of "an"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-30 00:12:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/openstack/common/strutils.py'], 'message': 'Wrong usage of "an"

Wrong usage of "an" in the messages:
"Converts a string into an float representation"
Should be:
"Converts a string into a float representation"

Totally 1 occurrence in python-cinderclient base code.

Change-Id: I5fb871c0d38b8337e862c822d9157c10ccdddf89
'}]
commit_message:
Wrong usage of "an"

Wrong usage of "an" in the messages:
"Converts a string into an float representation"
Should be:
"Converts a string into a float representation"

Totally 1 occurrence in python-cinderclient base code.

Change-Id: I5fb871c0d38b8337e862c822d9157c10ccdddf89

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-03-15 06:15:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_xio.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/xio.py'], 'message': 'Encode the url parameters for XIO driver

Many URI include components consisting of or delimited by, certain
special characters.  These characters are called "reserved", since
their usage within the URI component is limited to their reserved
purpose.  If the data for a URI component would conflict with the
reserved purpose, then the conflicting data must be escaped before
forming the URI.

  reserved = ";" | "/" | "?" | ":" | "@" | "&" | "=" | "+" |
           "$" | ","

refs:
  http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2396.txt
  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4667942/why-should-i-use-urlencode

Change-Id: I40ee5af9553af8ebb15558a2f89b247c83d79cff
'}]
commit_message:
Encode the url parameters for XIO driver

Many URI include components consisting of or delimited by, certain
special characters.  These characters are called "reserved", since
their usage within the URI component is limited to their reserved
purpose.  If the data for a URI component would conflict with the
reserved purpose, then the conflicting data must be escaped before
forming the URI.

  reserved = ";" | "/" | "?" | ":" | "@" | "&" | "=" | "+" |
           "$" | ","

refs:
  http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2396.txt
  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4667942/why-should-i-use-urlencode

Change-Id: I40ee5af9553af8ebb15558a2f89b247c83d79cff

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-12-14 22:03:31.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/local_dev/lvm.py', 'etc/cinder/rootwrap.d/volume.filters', 'cinder/tests/unit/brick/test_brick_lvm.py'], 'message': "All Cinder LVM operations run with LVM_SYSTEM_DIR

Up to now only a subset of LVM commands (pvs, vgs, lvs & lvdisplay)
ran with an appropriate LVM_SYSTEM_DIR value set in their environment,
based upon the lvm_conf_file config option.

As a result this meant that the /etc/lvm/lvm.conf file still had to
permit scanning of the devices providing the LVM PVs backing Cinder's
Volume Groups. Which of course means that the host and Cinder LVM
operations were not truly isolated from each other.

This has now been rectified by ensuring that all LVM commands are run
with an appropriate LVM_SYSTEM_DIR environment setting.

All LVM commands are constructed as a cmd list prior to being passed
to the _lvm() method or lvm_cmd() staticmethod.

Updated the etc/cinder/rootwrap.d/volume.filters entries for all the
LVM commands to reflect this; they now use the EnvFilter rather than
CommandFilter. Removed redundant _lvmconf filter entries.

Affected unit tests, such as those for Brick LVM, have been updated
to work with this new model.

Notes with regard to Upgrades:
==============================
There shouldn't be any impact on upgrade as a result of this patch
unless a pre-existing effort has been made to fully isolate the host
LVM environment from the Cinder LVM environment by having the host
/etc/lvm/lvm.conf file ignore the devices that will be backing the
Cinder LVM VGs.

However, given that this patch is intended to fix the issues that
prevented the deployment of a system with true isolation of the
host and Cinder LVM environments, I don't believe there is likely
to be any upgrade impact.

If no lvm_conf_file is specified in cinder.conf then before and
after this change any Cinder LVM commands will have been using the
system default lvm.conf file.

If an lvm_conf_file was previously specified, and it used filtering
to limit the set of devices scanned to only those devices that
Cinder should be targeting, then the effect would have been limited
to the show/display commands, whereas now all Cinder generated
LVM commands will be affected. This shouldn't cause problems since
Cinder LVM commands shouldn't be trying to access other devices on
the system anyway.

Change-Id: I9420c3d8b232367b610622d94e8923dedcc314e6
Closes-Bug: #1506220
UpgradeImpact
"}]
commit_message:
All Cinder LVM operations run with LVM_SYSTEM_DIR

Up to now only a subset of LVM commands (pvs, vgs, lvs & lvdisplay)
ran with an appropriate LVM_SYSTEM_DIR value set in their environment,
based upon the lvm_conf_file config option.

As a result this meant that the /etc/lvm/lvm.conf file still had to
permit scanning of the devices providing the LVM PVs backing Cinder's
Volume Groups. Which of course means that the host and Cinder LVM
operations were not truly isolated from each other.

This has now been rectified by ensuring that all LVM commands are run
with an appropriate LVM_SYSTEM_DIR environment setting.

All LVM commands are constructed as a cmd list prior to being passed
to the _lvm() method or lvm_cmd() staticmethod.

Updated the etc/cinder/rootwrap.d/volume.filters entries for all the
LVM commands to reflect this; they now use the EnvFilter rather than
CommandFilter. Removed redundant _lvmconf filter entries.

Affected unit tests, such as those for Brick LVM, have been updated
to work with this new model.

Notes with regard to Upgrades:
==============================
There shouldn't be any impact on upgrade as a result of this patch
unless a pre-existing effort has been made to fully isolate the host
LVM environment from the Cinder LVM environment by having the host
/etc/lvm/lvm.conf file ignore the devices that will be backing the
Cinder LVM VGs.

However, given that this patch is intended to fix the issues that
prevented the deployment of a system with true isolation of the
host and Cinder LVM environments, I don't believe there is likely
to be any upgrade impact.

If no lvm_conf_file is specified in cinder.conf then before and
after this change any Cinder LVM commands will have been using the
system default lvm.conf file.

If an lvm_conf_file was previously specified, and it used filtering
to limit the set of devices scanned to only those devices that
Cinder should be targeting, then the effect would have been limited
to the show/display commands, whereas now all Cinder generated
LVM commands will be affected. This shouldn't cause problems since
Cinder LVM commands shouldn't be trying to access other devices on
the system anyway.

Change-Id: I9420c3d8b232367b610622d94e8923dedcc314e6
Closes-Bug: #1506220
UpgradeImpact

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-03 13:44:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py'], 'message': 'Show the original backtrace for failures in initialize_connection()

If a volume driver crashes in initialize_connection(), the single-argument
invocation of "raise" dropped the original backtrace, leaving this line
as the last hint to what went wrong.

This is clearly non-optimal; debugging is much easier if the correct
location gets pointed out.


So, use the 3-argument version, and re-use the original backtrace.

Change-Id: Ib887b1d061c67b65a0d5e2545940a8d9f635a959
'}]
commit_message:
Show the original backtrace for failures in initialize_connection()

If a volume driver crashes in initialize_connection(), the single-argument
invocation of "raise" dropped the original backtrace, leaving this line
as the last hint to what went wrong.

This is clearly non-optimal; debugging is much easier if the correct
location gets pointed out.


So, use the 3-argument version, and re-use the original backtrace.

Change-Id: Ib887b1d061c67b65a0d5e2545940a8d9f635a959

CGSnapshotStatusField, that will hold the constants for
the 'status' field of the CGSnapshot object. This enum and
field are based off the base oslo.versionedobjects enum
and field. This also changes over the CGSnapshot object
to use the new field (and bumps the version so newer
versions know to enforce valid values). Finally all
uses of strings for comparison and assignment to this
field are changed over to use the constants defined
within the enum.

Change-Id: I5efc30a43e82ec1990d3378e90988d0d73dc5198
Implements: bp cinder-object-fields
"}]
commit_message:
Add CGSnapshotStatus enum field

This change adds a new enum and field, CGSnapshotStatus and
CGSnapshotStatusField, that will hold the constants for
the 'status' field of the CGSnapshot object. This enum and
field are based off the base oslo.versionedobjects enum
and field. This also changes over the CGSnapshot object
to use the new field (and bumps the version so newer
versions know to enforce valid values). Finally all
uses of strings for comparison and assignment to this
field are changed over to use the constants defined
within the enum.

Change-Id: I5efc30a43e82ec1990d3378e90988d0d73dc5198
Implements: bp cinder-object-fields

subject: Parse filter item "name" correctly for snapshot-list
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-25 03:51:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Parse filter item "name" correctly for snapshot-list

Use non-admin user, cinderclient will parse filter item
"name" to "display_name" when get snapshot list via v2 api,
this will make cinder remove the filter as an invalid filter
item and return the full snapshot list, so parse the "name"
to "name" will fix the problem.

Change-Id: I94439b082bf6ad56d3e84d3301e1869343ceae55
Closes-Bug: #1554538
'}]
commit_message:
Parse filter item "name" correctly for snapshot-list

Use non-admin user, cinderclient will parse filter item
"name" to "display_name" when get snapshot list via v2 api,
this will make cinder remove the filter as an invalid filter
item and return the full snapshot list, so parse the "name"
to "name" will fix the problem.

Change-Id: I94439b082bf6ad56d3e84d3301e1869343ceae55
Closes-Bug: #1554538

commit_message:
Print a more readable output of upload-to-image

when we print a large dict of the detail of volume type in
output of upload-to-image, that's not readable at all.

Instead of outputing a confusing output, this commit makes
upload-to-image only print volume type id. That makes the
output much better.

Closes-Bug: #1557486
Change-Id: Ia2f29fa39a80aec2289775d6efd45f434653e5a0

Now that we support having multiple c-vol nodes serving the same storage
backend under one "host", they no longer clean all resources from that
host on start, only those from their own node.  So we need a way to
trigger the cleanup of the resources that were being processed by a
failed node.

This patch adds a new API endpoint (/workers/cleanup) that will trigger
cleanup for c-vol nodes as microversion 3.3.

The cleanup will be performed by other nodes that share the same host,
so at least one of them must be up to be able to do the cleanup.

Cleanup cannot be triggered during a cloud upgrade, but a restarted node
will still cleanup it's own resources during an upgrade.

If no arguments are provided cleanup will issue a clean message for all
nodes that are down, but we can restrict which nodes we want to be
cleaned using parameters `service_id`, `host`, `binary`, `node_id`,
`disabled`, `name`.

Cleaning specific resources is also possible using `resource_type` and
`resource_id` parameters.

We can even force cleanup on nodes that are up with `is_up`, but that's
not recommended.

API will return a dictionary with 2 lists, one with nodes that have been
issued a cleanup request (`cleaning`) and another list with nodes that
cannot be cleaned right now because there is no alternative node to do
the cleanup in that host (`unavailable`).

Data returned for each node in the lists is the same as the summary list
of nodes: `id`, `name` and `state`.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/236977
Patch in series: 5/7

APIImpact: New /workers/cleanup entry
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Ide615714e5179e40242fdb639432c7dd393fb7e7
'}]
commit_message:
Allow triggering cleanup from API

Now that we support having multiple c-vol nodes serving the same storage
backend under one "host", they no longer clean all resources from that
host on start, only those from their own node.  So we need a way to
trigger the cleanup of the resources that were being processed by a
failed node.

This patch adds a new API endpoint (/workers/cleanup) that will trigger
cleanup for c-vol nodes as microversion 3.3.

The cleanup will be performed by other nodes that share the same host,
so at least one of them must be up to be able to do the cleanup.

Cleanup cannot be triggered during a cloud upgrade, but a restarted node
will still cleanup it's own resources during an upgrade.

If no arguments are provided cleanup will issue a clean message for all
nodes that are down, but we can restrict which nodes we want to be
cleaned using parameters `service_id`, `host`, `binary`, `node_id`,
`disabled`, `name`.

Cleaning specific resources is also possible using `resource_type` and
`resource_id` parameters.

We can even force cleanup on nodes that are up with `is_up`, but that's
not recommended.

API will return a dictionary with 2 lists, one with nodes that have been
issued a cleanup request (`cleaning`) and another list with nodes that
cannot be cleaned right now because there is no alternative node to do
the cleanup in that host (`unavailable`).

Data returned for each node in the lists is the same as the summary list
of nodes: `id`, `name` and `state`.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/236977
Patch in series: 5/7

APIImpact: New /workers/cleanup entry
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Ide615714e5179e40242fdb639432c7dd393fb7e7

commit_message:
Make c-bak use workers table for cleanup

To be able to support multiple nodes working with the same resources we
have added the workers table to keep track of which node is working with
each specific resource.

This patch makes c-bak service work with this new table by adding
entries on cleanable operations and removing them once these operations
have completed.

Service cleanup on initialization has also been changed to use this new
table so nodes will cleanup only resources from operations they left on
the air and leave any operations that are being processed by other nodes.

Backup nodes have been traditionally tightly coupled to volume nodes,
and though we now have the possibility to scale out backups
independently of volumes we may still force backups only to work if the
backup and volume services are on the same node.

And it's for this case, where we have them in the same node as we used
to, that we need c-bak to also support the workers mechanism, because we
can deploy c-vol in HA A-A fashion together with c-bak.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/236977
Patch in series: 6/7

APIImpact: `/workers/cleanup` now accepts "Backup" as resource_type
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Iadc26f20cdfea52d074723a46ec1e5f59853937e

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-04-19 10:09:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/rpcapi.py', 'cinder/objects/base.py', 'cinder/scheduler/manager.py', 'cinder/api/openstack/api_version_request.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_scheduler.py', 'cinder/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_workers.py', 'cinder/opts.py', 'releasenotes/notes/node_auto_cleanup-c3527fd3586a3316.yaml', 'cinder/api/contrib/workers.py', 'cinder/objects/cleanup_request.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'Add auto cleanup mechanism

may want those nodes to be automatically cleaned.

This patch adds this functionality to do auto cleanup on nodes that go
down after a specific number of seconds have elapsed since the last
heartbeat of the node.

The number of seconds is defined as a multiple of `service_down_time`
with `auto_cleanup_checks` configuration option.

Even if this functionality is disabled by default we can easily enable
it with configuration option `auto_cleanup_enabled` or we can manually
trigger it using new API entry point `/workers/auto_cleanup` with
microversion 3.4.

In the same way that the `/workers/cleanup` does, this new API will
return a dictionary with a list of nodes that are going to be cleaned
(`cleaning` key) and a list of nodes that cannot be cleaned because
there is no other node in the host that can do the cleaning
(`unavailable` key).

Data returned for each node in the lists is the same as the summary list
of nodes: `id`, `name` and `state`.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/236977
Patch in series: 7/7

DocImpact: New configuration options: auto_cleanup_checks and
           enable_auto_cleanup

Change-Id: Ib0f04b7d7bf85bc97dc9773bfdb0b082e18f0b08
'}]
commit_message:
Add auto cleanup mechanism

When working in Active-Active configurations nodes may go down, and we
may want those nodes to be automatically cleaned.

This patch adds this functionality to do auto cleanup on nodes that go
down after a specific number of seconds have elapsed since the last
heartbeat of the node.

The number of seconds is defined as a multiple of `service_down_time`
with `auto_cleanup_checks` configuration option.

Even if this functionality is disabled by default we can easily enable
it with configuration option `auto_cleanup_enabled` or we can manually
trigger it using new API entry point `/workers/auto_cleanup` with
microversion 3.4.

In the same way that the `/workers/cleanup` does, this new API will
return a dictionary with a list of nodes that are going to be cleaned
(`cleaning` key) and a list of nodes that cannot be cleaned because
there is no other node in the host that can do the cleaning
(`unavailable` key).

Data returned for each node in the lists is the same as the summary list
of nodes: `id`, `name` and `state`.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/236977
Patch in series: 7/7

APIImpact: New /worker/auto_cleanup entry
DocImpact: New configuration options: auto_cleanup_checks and
           enable_auto_cleanup
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Ib0f04b7d7bf85bc97dc9773bfdb0b082e18f0b08

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-27 10:04:13.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'After pool is introduced, cinder should support compatible

After pool is introduced in the BP "pool-aware-cinder-scheduler",
if the driver has not supported it, In the process, the backend
name is specified as the pool name.But if the driver later
implemented it, pool name is the back-end driver reported.
The scheme: when start volume service, we can get all
volumes by the host, then extract pool information from
volume's host. If the pool is None or volume_backend_name,
we call get_pool query the pool_name from driver, then
modify the volume's host information.

Closes-Bug: #1574503

Change-Id: I8b7ccad17ed002273a9475140edc93567c6ba73e
'}]
commit_message:
After pool is introduced, cinder should support compatible

After pool is introduced in the BP "pool-aware-cinder-scheduler",
if the driver has not supported it, In the process, the backend
name is specified as the pool name.But if the driver later
implemented it, pool name is the back-end driver reported.
The scheme: when start volume service, we can get all
volumes by the host, then extract pool information from
volume's host. If the pool is None or volume_backend_name,
we call get_pool query the pool_name from driver, then
modify the volume's host information.

Closes-Bug: #1574503

Change-Id: I8b7ccad17ed002273a9475140edc93567c6ba73e

commit_message:
Make Nova API version configurable

Nova API version is hard-coded in Cinder code. It should be
configurable.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint make-nova-api-version-configurable

commit_message:
DB: Optimize snapshot existence check

When checking for the existence of a snapshot, don't
perform a joined load which pulls much more data
than is needed.

This code mirrors the way this is implemented for
volume queries.

Related-Bug: #1579903

Change-Id: I52ef7b4d6b224c53d2ea33ab6c1a267da789ac28

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-21 08:52:57.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v3/client.py', 'cinderclient/v3/shell.py', 'releasenotes/notes/service-node-cleanup-55a2081087db58ca.yaml', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_workers.py', 'cinderclient/api_versions.py', 'cinderclient/v3/service_nodes.py', 'cinderclient/v3/workers.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/fakes.py'], 'message': 'Add service node cleanup command

Volumes nodes will perform cleanup on start, but when we have multiple
volume nodes grouped under the same host we may want to trigger cleanup

commit_message:
Add service node cleanup command

Volumes nodes will perform cleanup on start, but when we have multiple
volume nodes grouped under the same host we may want to trigger cleanup
of nodes that are down.

This patch adds command `work-clean` to trigger server cleanups and
prints service nodes that will be cleaned.

This command will only work on servers supporting API version 3.3 or
higher.

New command:

cinder work-clean [--name <node-name>] [--host <hostname>]
                  [--binary <binary>] [--service-id <service-id>]
                  [--node-id <hostname>] [--resource-id <resource-id>]
                  [--resource-type <Volume|Snapshot>]
                  [--disabled <True|true|False|false>] [--exclude-down]
                  [--include-up]

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/236977
Patch in series: 3/5

Depends-On: Ide615714e5179e40242fdb639432c7dd393fb7e7
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Iebcbe9c0bd77537e9bb0cc8095fc290b800937a9

commit_message:
Add Backup to cleanable resource types

Command `node-clean` only accepted "Volume" and "Snapshot" values for
--resource-type.

This patch adds "Backup" resource-type since they are now cleanable as
well.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/236977
Patch in series: 4/5

Depends-On: Iadc26f20cdfea52d074723a46ec1e5f59853937e
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I6ceca7d8160d2f987bdde95d6da46e66a30fc7ce

Volumes nodes will perform cleanup on start, but for cases when a node
doesn't come back up or doesn't have a passive node that will replace it

We can auto trigger this auto cleanup mechanism even when it is

This patch adds the 'work-autoclean' command to trigger the auto cleanup
on the cloud.

This command will only work on servers with API version 3.4 or higher.

New command: cinder work-autoclean

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/236977
Patch in series: 5/5

commit_message:
Add service node auto-cleanup

Volumes nodes will perform cleanup on start, but for cases when a node
doesn't come back up or doesn't have a passive node that will replace it
because we are using an Active/Active configuration Cinder has an auto
cleanup mechanism.

We can auto trigger this auto cleanup mechanism even when it is
disabled.

This patch adds the 'work-autoclean' command to trigger the auto cleanup
on the cloud.

This command will only work on servers with API version 3.4 or higher.

New command: cinder work-autoclean

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/236977
Patch in series: 5/5

Depends-On: Ib0f04b7d7bf85bc97dc9773bfdb0b082e18f0b08
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support

commit_message:
Cleanup for Volume Object

Changed all occurrences of volume to object notation in the api.py
which don't require a change to the unit tests

All other occurrences which require change to unit tests will be
changed in another follow-up patch. This will help it easier to
review and improve readability

Change-Id: I83633d059270592ad98ecaa0934ab96114496af2
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-04-21 07:21:50.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v3/shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Add backup import from file to cinderclient api

In order to be able to restore a volume backup on another
block storage, we need a command that will enable to import
a backup into the db from backup_metadata file.

Implements: blueprint cinder-backup-import-record-from-backup-metadata-file
Depends-on: I63075f38e551af943a671664a8951614d1b3849f

Conflicts:
	cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_shell.py
	cinderclient/v3/shell.py

Change-Id: I1f3e2d183a988959616efec442bc5948ee8da5bf
'}]
commit_message:
Add backup import from file to cinderclient api

In order to be able to restore a volume backup on another
block storage, we need a command that will enable to import
a backup into the db from backup_metadata file.

Implements: blueprint cinder-backup-import-record-from-backup-metadata-file
Depends-on: I63075f38e551af943a671664a8951614d1b3849f

Conflicts:
	cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_shell.py
	cinderclient/v3/shell.py

Change-Id: I1f3e2d183a988959616efec442bc5948ee8da5bf

commit_message:
Add a hacking check stdlib logging rather than oslo.log

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/265559 fixed up the existing
cases. This check is added to prevent any new ones.

Change-Id: I60b5170ae1cbf969f77d3350f75998941847170e
Closes-bug: 1553865

type-access-add operation does not return anything.
But for every create operation, cinder returns details
about operation like id, status etc.

This patchset will add details in output of type-access-add

Change-Id: I34dadff808622fe4a65b8e7c0ceda6212f0b7ac8

commit_message:
Missing output in type-access-add

type-access-add operation does not return anything.
But for every create operation, cinder returns details
about operation like id, status etc.

This patchset will add details in output of type-access-add
operation.

Change-Id: I34dadff808622fe4a65b8e7c0ceda6212f0b7ac8
Closes-Bug:#1567376

commit_message:
Support for checking JSON format

This tool is required to check JSON syntax for cinder api-ref.

I need to clean API-ref for JSON formats..still in progress.
This tool will serve the purpose to verify after cleaning of
json format in existing api-ref json files.

Change-Id: I079c71b1ecb08fe63aa25beb68ccf27cdbda8e6e

commit_message:
Return multipath device from get_volume_paths

This only adresses the issue for the FC and iSCSI connectors. We will
now add the multipath paths onto the list that is returned.

Change-Id: Iaa5814e4bb25f552388a1ee94cd100ff80001231
Closes-Bug: #1577592

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-11 16:04:04.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_xio.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/xio.py'], 'message': 'Add configurable presentation delay to X-IO driver

This patch adds a delay to the X-IO driver in the
initialize_connection path. The delay is configurable
using the ise_present_wait option and is there to address
issues on some hosts that look for the connected device
before it has shown up in the OS. This has only been
seen on FC hosts.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I27b02647ca22ca388d1cbc6f46d80d1b6d76bb54
Closes-Bug: #1551023
'}]
commit_message:
Add configurable presentation delay to X-IO driver

This patch adds a delay to the X-IO driver in the
initialize_connection path. The delay is configurable
using the ise_present_wait option and is there to address
issues on some hosts that look for the connected device
before it has shown up in the OS. This has only been
seen on FC hosts.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I27b02647ca22ca388d1cbc6f46d80d1b6d76bb54
Closes-Bug: #1551023

In case the lun_id is passed as string the _format_lun_id()
code fails. Check if the input is of type int, raise error
if not. Convert lun_id in process_lun_id() to int before
pass it as parameter to _format_lun_id(). Added new test case.

Closes-Bug: #1554184

Change-Id: If59f3df35549918bd5ddfeafc9141578ce28544a
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that lun_id is integer before use '&' operand

In case the lun_id is passed as string the _format_lun_id()
code fails. Check if the input is of type int, raise error
if not. Convert lun_id in process_lun_id() to int before
pass it as parameter to _format_lun_id(). Added new test case.

Closes-Bug: #1554184

Change-Id: If59f3df35549918bd5ddfeafc9141578ce28544a
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

[{'number': 24, 'created': '2016-02-15 22:17:41.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/optimization-with-local-path-0423aae081844f58.yaml', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': 'Migration: take the direct path for the source volume

During volume migration, if the driver can provide the direct
path for the source volume directly, there is no need to get
it via attaching the source volume.

This patch adds the implementation of the method
get_direct_volume_path to provide
the path, which can be used to access the volume data directly.
If this method returns None, there is no direct path available.
Otherwise, the path it returns can be used to access the volume
to copy the data. This patch takes LVM as the reference
implementation.

Change-Id: I2ac243c630fb264652db6e96d27da1c9baf54bbf
Closes-Bug: #1520087
'}]
commit_message:
Migration: take the direct path for the source volume

During volume migration, if the driver can provide the direct
path for the source volume directly, there is no need to get
it via attaching the source volume.

This patch adds the implementation of the method
get_direct_volume_path to provide
the path, which can be used to access the volume data directly.
If this method returns None, there is no direct path available.
Otherwise, the path it returns can be used to access the volume
to copy the data. This patch takes LVM as the reference
implementation.

Change-Id: I2ac243c630fb264652db6e96d27da1c9baf54bbf
Closes-Bug: #1520087

Removed 'u' from output of type-show command

In output of cinder type-show command, extra 'u'
is getting printed.

Removed this extra 'u' from the output of
type-show command.

commit_message:
RBDClient: pass clustername and conffile to Rados

Read and forward the Ceph clustername and path to config file
to the os_brick rbd initiator to allow connection to clusters
with non-default names.

Extended existing test_connector test with new parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1563889

Change-Id: I904f47d49295547774da184b91befdd04cd8f861
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>
Co-Authored-By: Marc Fiedler <marc.fiedler@telekom.de>

commit_message:
support reset the state of consistency groups

The state of cg will be error when volumes to join cg fails.
Add reset-state API to support reset the state of cgs to the right
state.

Implements: bp reset-consistencygroup-state

Change-Id: Id60e0ce9386afa8c02f130d749d05df172edd753

commit_message:
Add wraps function to sqlalchemy decorators

In order to preserve the docstring and function name the decorator
"wraps" is needed.

See:
https://docs.python.org/2/library/functools.html#functools.wraps

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0dbbade2a4485a1640f8ce27b8de4048fd3134c5

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-16 09:43:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/v2/views/volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/v2/test_volumes.py'], 'message': 'Unify the type of value for what are True/False values

A bootable field in volume data returned from api
is a string data type.
However, a crypted field is a boolean data type.

The type of value which can be True or False should be boolean.

This issue is causing a another issue in horizon.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1587263

Change-Id: Idf9916f7cd5cd9bd941dcba1c626c662ea0493ff
Closes-Bug: #1589865
'}]
commit_message:
Unify the type of value for what are True/False values

A bootable field in volume data returned from api
is a string data type.
However, a crypted field is a boolean data type.

The type of value which can be True or False should be boolean.

This issue is causing a another issue in horizon.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1587263

Change-Id: Idf9916f7cd5cd9bd941dcba1c626c662ea0493ff
Closes-Bug: #1589865

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-20 22:09:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py'], 'message': '3PAR: Fix delete volume when online clone

When an online clone volume is deleted, the clone needs to be stopped
first. On delete, a new exception is raised from the 3PAR. We need to
check for the error code when hpeexceptions.HTTPConflict is raised.

Change-Id: I99020465455a4688b67e2fe1b4a9964616b3fcc1
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR: Fix delete volume when online clone

When an online clone volume is deleted, the clone needs to be stopped
first. On delete, a new exception is raised from the 3PAR. We need to
check for the error code when hpeexceptions.HTTPConflict is raised.

Change-Id: I99020465455a4688b67e2fe1b4a9964616b3fcc1

commit_message:
Add missing user message

Currently there is no message given by python cinderclient after
successfully accepting the request of delete snapshot and force delete
volume.To maintain consistency with other commands like delete volume
this message is added

Change-Id: Ia6933dd45f445fa312c5c64ca741dc2868aa4fa2
Closes-Bug: #1534060

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-04-19 06:29:54.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/common.py', 'cinder/api/v2/volumes.py', 'cinder/api/openstack/api_version_request.py', 'cinder/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/v2/stubs.py', 'cinder/objects/snapshot.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/v2/test_volumes.py'], 'message': "Inherit multiattach from volume source

We should also update volume's mutiattach attribute when creating
from snapshot, source volume, or source replica. Currently the
created volume always set multiattach to False, even the source
snapshot/volume/replica/ is allowing multiattach.

This patch adds code to inherit multiattach from the source where
volume is created. The code is added in API layer so that I can
distinguish whether user has explicitly specified a multiattach
attribute. I didn't change API v1, because I think new feature
should only be added to newer version of APIs. I didn't see code to
create volume from source CG, so there is no multiattach inheriting
for that yet (If someone points that out I'm glad to change).

A new API microversion, 3.2, is also added.

APIImpact
Change-Id: I6a39d03108fd570af9095ffc7b1a0d9dd3a23830
Closes-Bug: #1505875
"}]
commit_message:
Inherit multiattach from volume source

We should also update volume's mutiattach attribute when creating
from snapshot, source volume, or source replica. Currently the
created volume always set multiattach to False, even the source
snapshot/volume/replica/ is allowing multiattach.

This patch adds code to inherit multiattach from the source where
volume is created. The code is added in API layer so that I can
distinguish whether user has explicitly specified a multiattach
attribute. I didn't change API v1, because I think new feature
should only be added to newer version of APIs. I didn't see code to
create volume from source CG, so there is no multiattach inheriting
for that yet (If someone points that out I'm glad to change).

A new API microversion, 3.2, is also added.

APIImpact
Change-Id: I6a39d03108fd570af9095ffc7b1a0d9dd3a23830
Closes-Bug: #1505875

commit_message:
Updated volume, version, limit, metadata API-ref

Below changes are done in this patchset
1. Updated the index files.
2. Added missing api-extensions.inc.
3. updated parameters.yaml for all parameters used in inc files.
4. Fixed existing bug - Added 'bootable' filter in volume list.

Implements: bp api-reference-to-rst

Closes-Bug:#1536845

Change-Id: I02ad2372a564163916e802b3342dc9d551c7ba51

commit_message:
Fix wrong volume type of restore action

Automatically restore volume to its original type when a dest
volume_id is not specified. If the original type has already
been deleted, fallback to a default volume type.

APIImpact

Change-Id: Ic8a25fc9daeca0db1642358a918aecfd961b1989
Closes-Bug: #1567263

subject: Add max-width feature to limit the width of the printed table
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-08 05:09:55.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v3/shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'cinderclient/v1/shell.py', 'cinderclient/utils.py'], 'message': "Add max-width feature to limit the width of the printed table

Sometimes the output of the printed table is not friendly readable.
Especially for the *-show commands since the detail information
usually includes many words, for instance [1].

For more user-friendly format, we'd better add a max-width feature
to limit the width of the column(0 by default which means unlimited).

In this patch, we only consider the *-show commands.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/497826/

Change-Id: I3977b63a203c2e443ed7baf5d357bfac5af145f5
"}]
commit_message:
Add max-width feature to limit the width of the printed table

Sometimes the output of the printed table is not friendly readable.
Especially for the *-show commands since the detail information
usually includes many words, for instance [1].

For more user-friendly format, we'd better add a max-width feature
to limit the width of the column(0 by default which means unlimited).

In this patch, we only consider the *-show commands.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/497826/

Change-Id: I3977b63a203c2e443ed7baf5d357bfac5af145f5

commit_message:
WIP: Update LVM code so nova can use it

This patch is a WIP

The purpose of this patch is to reconcile the differences between
the lvm.py code in brick already with the Nova lvm.py code, so that Nova
can use brick's lvm code for managing LVM groups and volumes.

Change-Id: I39e7e6ddc9bd9951fa10017025e5110fa705ee0f

commit_message:
remove redundant image fetch

When creating volume from image, it makes redundant image fetch
even if option 'image_volume_cache' is disabled. optimization
should be made to improve the performance of volume-creating.
This patch is to fix the problem.

Change-Id: I3f0e6e461d987520b1502fee436d8b90774712ca
Closes-Bug: #1594299

Cinder_volume does not check whether there are connections before

detach volume.

Change-Id: I299d369d0605d631d0dd7bf983fcd8bb15504861
Closes-Bug: #1477831

commit_message:
LVM+tgt:iscsi target deleted after VM live migrate

Cinder_volume does not check whether there are connections before
excutes 'tgt-admin --force --delete' in the func
'remove_iscsi_target'. That leads to iscsi target be removed after
detach volume.

Change-Id: I299d369d0605d631d0dd7bf983fcd8bb15504861
Closes-Bug: #1477831

commit_message:
Use "image" as argument for Glance V1 upload error path

In Glance V1 the argument is "image", not "image_id", so use this on
the error path to cleanup.

Change-Id: Ie64e2911798cef17f1263d961d70f7715b2ba64b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-16 02:27:40.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': 'Fix the ansible-func-centos-7-nv test

The ansible-func-centos-7-nv test fails because the package names for
dependencies are different in CentOS than Ubuntu.

This adds specific packages for dpkg and rpm based systems.

Change-Id: I2ab79fed6ec838d2302edc855957bb48d5178932
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the ansible-func-centos-7-nv test

The ansible-func-centos-7-nv test fails because the package names for
dependencies are different in CentOS than Ubuntu.

This adds specific packages for dpkg and rpm based systems.

Change-Id: I2ab79fed6ec838d2302edc855957bb48d5178932

commit_message:
Fix create_volume_from_snapshot in Huawei driver

In create_volume_from_snapshot function, there's
no 'provider_location' in return values. And it
leads detach snapshot volume failed on the array.
This bug is only exists in liberty. So fix it on
stable/liberty.

Change-Id: I784b0b0962cae7ccd31f953b29ba8992774159ca
Closes-Bug: #1541234

In case the backend does not have the image snapshot anymore,
log an info message and succeed the operation.
A first attempt to fix this problem was found on
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151257/
This patch is already merged but it does not fix the problem
completely.

Closes-Bug: #1415905
(cherry picked from commit 677eb1c4160c08cfce2900495741f0ea15f566fa)

Change-Id: I51b0f5bb2bb60144dace79ebed06a66aaeb54574
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: delete snapshots if missing in the backend

snapshot delete should be more robust to also handle backend errors.
In case the backend does not have the image snapshot anymore,
log an info message and succeed the operation.
A first attempt to fix this problem was found on
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151257/
This patch is already merged but it does not fix the problem
completely.

Closes-Bug: #1415905
(cherry picked from commit 677eb1c4160c08cfce2900495741f0ea15f566fa)

Change-Id: I51b0f5bb2bb60144dace79ebed06a66aaeb54574

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-11 09:24:29.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/utils.py', 'cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': 'Verify if snapshot is already managed

Currenly in lvm, snapshot id is verified from volume db entries
to confirm if snapshot being managed is already managed by cinder
or not.
But that will always return false.
So, this check is wrong and should be modified to verify against
snapshot db entries.
Added method to check if snapshot is already\xa0managed while snapshot
manage operation.

Change-Id: I591905c8afd447490c709b44c63255c10edef875
Closes-Bug: #1525887
'}]
commit_message:
Verify if snapshot is already managed

Currenly in lvm, snapshot id is verified from volume db entries
to confirm if snapshot being managed is already managed by cinder
or not.
But that will always return false.
So, this check is wrong and should be modified to verify against
snapshot db entries.
Added method to check if snapshot is already managed while snapshot
manage operation.

Change-Id: I591905c8afd447490c709b44c63255c10edef875
Closes-Bug: #1525887

commit_message:
Allow API user to update multiattach attr of volume

This change allow API user to update the ``multiattach``
attr of a volume. User can update this attr of a volume which
in status 'available', otherwise an exception of InvalidVolume
is returned.

APIImpact

Closes-Bug: #1572996
Change-Id: Iafc4bf67b67a3ec9149f824d7fe16b8bdc116835

commit_message:
Backup and restore broken in zfssaiscsi driver

Volume backup and restore functionality in the iscsi driver needs
to fall back on the base driver's implementation.
This fix is for the driver in Liberty and needs to be backported.

Change-Id: I3f2751a89241a7779c964746dc815dd9b23ef40b
Closes-Bug: #1591332
(cherry picked from commit c68892af439c1365e2708ed7ad532a0b46b7f5a0)

commit_message:
Add a base attribute 'id' for resources

This patch will add a new base attribute 'id',
which means resource_id of the resource. And for this
attribute we don't have to get from other services by api.

Change-Id: I217388486a77aa7c8dfe2309a818f07d2191a793
Closes-Bug: #1613958

Previously, the revocation matching engine was basically a black box

Change-Id: I751d891dc1cec2bb22ad6a3948aafaa34fc835d1

commit_message:
Add debug logging to revocation event checking

Previously, the revocation matching engine was basically a black box
that seemed to mysteriously match some tokens and not others, and it was
difficult to understand why an event would match a given token at a
glance. Fixed.

Change-Id: I751d891dc1cec2bb22ad6a3948aafaa34fc835d1

subject: Add info about ports to sf_svip config entry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 20:05:19.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/tables/cinder-solidfire.xml'], 'message': 'Add info about ports to sf_svip config entry

The SolidFire config ref was updated to include the requirement
of specifying sf_svip in the config file when using vlans,
however the update doesn't mention the fact that when specifying
this option the admin MUST also include the port number in the ip.

So rather than just "10.5.3.4" it must be of the form "10.5.3.4:3260".

The mitaka release (forward) will automatically append a default
port number in the driver, but that's not available in Liberty.

This patch just updates the Liberty docs to point out that port
number is required in the argument.

Change-Id: I25b4432df63831a42921ed28dab1699f321562a0
Closes-Bug: #1614243
'}]
commit_message:
Add info about ports to sf_svip config entry

The SolidFire config ref was updated to include the requirement
of specifying sf_svip in the config file when using vlans,
however the update doesn't mention the fact that when specifying
this option the admin MUST also include the port number in the ip.

So rather than just "10.5.3.4" it must be of the form "10.5.3.4:3260".

The mitaka release (forward) will automatically append a default
port number in the driver, but that's not available in Liberty.

This patch just updates the Liberty docs to point out that port
number is required in the argument.

Change-Id: I25b4432df63831a42921ed28dab1699f321562a0
Closes-Bug: #1614243

commit_message:
Replaced the term "tenant" with "project"

This patch avoids the mismatch between the legacy term tenant and
the future term project by replacing the term tenant with project.

This is a partial fix and the further patches will completely
remove the term "tenant" from the documentation to avoid any kind
of confusion.

Change-Id: I52adfa5831f504145c2f6f0018062c818518633f
Partial-Bug: #1475005

subject: Update page title on job and test pages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 23:09:34.000000000', 'files': ['app/js/controllers/test.js', 'app/js/controllers/job.js'], 'message': 'Update page title on job and test pages

This commit adds page title updates to the job and test pages using
the pageTitleService. Currently these pages only show "Job" or "Test"
in the title bar, but this sets the title to "Job: current-job" or
"Test: current-test" depending on the current page.

Change-Id: I8bae8d6e47cdcfbdef18314d20b4d313f7e2e5ca
Closes-Bug: #1614076
'}]
commit_message:
Update page title on job and test pages

This commit adds page title updates to the job and test pages using
the pageTitleService. Currently these pages only show "Job" or "Test"
in the title bar, but this sets the title to "Job: current-job" or
"Test: current-test" depending on the current page.

Change-Id: I8bae8d6e47cdcfbdef18314d20b4d313f7e2e5ca
Closes-Bug: #1614076

This caused an error on creating CoreOS bay.

Change-Id: I8d49df913fc169ce573365c5ca485cb56806e49e
Closes-Bug: #1611065

commit_message:
Correct the get_file patch in CoreOS template

In CoreOS templates, the pathes provided to get_file has a extra 's'.
This caused an error on creating CoreOS bay.

commit_message:
Add support for master elected component

For k8s bay in HA mode, current all master components are active.
Added support for master elected component to ensure only one
master component is active. This will enhance the concurrency
controller.

Change-Id: I8a5489df0878a384a38bf755851c98b170282a1f
Closes-Bug: #1504681

subject: Remove deb-websockify from projects.yaml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 22:37:38.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Remove deb-websockify from projects.yaml

The upstream deb-websockify repo is corrupt in a manner that gerrit/jgit
won't accept its objects. Specifically:

  warning in tree 7a80ca084167b04a732640a2f18ec86af55377fb:
  zeroPaddedFilemode: contains zero-padded file modes

This means we can't populate the repo properly which in turn breaks our
image builds when they try to clone and cache this repo. Work around
that for now until the upstream repo can be corrected by removing it
from projects.yaml.

For more information on how to fix repos in this state see:
https://www.perforce.com/blog/150109/git-out-vulnerability-out-fire but
tl:dr is run:

  git fast-export --all | (cd ../myFixedRepo; git fast-import)

Change-Id: I95c9bd5088c5c02440fbf15cd588884b5e0dd954
"}]
commit_message:
Remove deb-websockify from projects.yaml

The upstream deb-websockify repo is corrupt in a manner that gerrit/jgit
won't accept its objects. Specifically:

  warning in tree 7a80ca084167b04a732640a2f18ec86af55377fb:
  zeroPaddedFilemode: contains zero-padded file modes

This means we can't populate the repo properly which in turn breaks our
image builds when they try to clone and cache this repo. Work around
that for now until the upstream repo can be corrected by removing it
from projects.yaml.

For more information on how to fix repos in this state see:
https://www.perforce.com/blog/150109/git-out-vulnerability-out-fire but
tl:dr is run:

  git fast-export --all | (cd ../myFixedRepo; git fast-import)

Change-Id: I95c9bd5088c5c02440fbf15cd588884b5e0dd954

subject: Nodepool elements: Add a script to initialize urandom
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-17 22:22:36.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/initialize-urandom/static/usr/local/bin/initialize-urandom.py', 'nodepool/elements/initialize-urandom/README.rst'], 'message': 'Nodepool elements: Add a script to initialize urandom

In our Xenial images, we see unbound take a while to start because
it uses openssl which uses the getrandom call which can block during
early boot if the nonblocking random number generator is not yet
initialized.

This script uses haveged to quickly initialize the generator.

This commit only includes the script, a later commit will add the
rest of the necessary install steps to the element.

Change-Id: I09d18a0bad6c380fd149660ebfdaf6c12730dc74
'}]
commit_message:
Nodepool elements: Add a script to initialize urandom

In our Xenial images, we see unbound take a while to start because
it uses openssl which uses the getrandom call which can block during
early boot if the nonblocking random number generator is not yet
initialized.

This script uses haveged to quickly initialize the generator.

This commit only includes the script, a later commit will add the
rest of the necessary install steps to the element.

Change-Id: I09d18a0bad6c380fd149660ebfdaf6c12730dc74

commit_message:
Use glanceclient for functional tests

With the 2.36 microversion in nova the images proxy API is
deprecated and returns a 404. This change makes the functional
tests use glanceclient directly for listing images.

commit_message:
Image argument validation and declaration

- Added argument declaration to image specification
- Added validation of image arguments
- Removed target_variable property. Variables are now placed into
  variables equal to the argument name. This makes the code cleaner
  and avoids confusing re-mapping of argument to variable name for
  users.

Change-Id: I974ed6b659b83e16c6406811afee3a4b08f4d3ee
Partially-implements: image-generation-cli

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-09 22:35:01.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/local.conf'], 'message': "Update local.conf to ElasticSearch version 2.3.1

Devstack installs elasticsearch version 1.4.2 by default.

https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/pkg/elasticsearch.sh#L13

This version is really out of date and you can't run kibana
4.x against it.  The following patch finishes out 2.x support,
so we should try running against 2.x for now.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307504/

Change-Id: I1989dc491e4b6cb296bc5624f8cd6bb5c7b6ff45
"}]
commit_message:
Update local.conf to ElasticSearch version 2.3.1

Devstack installs elasticsearch version 1.4.2 by default.

https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/pkg/elasticsearch.sh#L13

This version is really out of date and you can't run kibana
4.x against it.  The following patch finishes out 2.x support,
so we should try running against 2.x for now.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307504/

Change-Id: I1989dc491e4b6cb296bc5624f8cd6bb5c7b6ff45

subject: Try increasing KeystoneWorkers to improve performance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 09:17:54.000000000', 'files': ['test-environments/worker-config.yaml'], 'message': "Try increasing KeystoneWorkers to improve performance

I've been seeing keystone related slow performance locally,
where Step3 (which creates users, roles etc) takes forever running
keystone commands.

Try bumping this from 1 to 4, as it may improve our CI runtimes.

Change-Id: I43b448ca5cbd54bfbfc632aa89a205f866b0fb5f
"}]
commit_message:
Try increasing KeystoneWorkers to improve performance

I've been seeing keystone related slow performance locally,
where Step3 (which creates users, roles etc) takes forever running
keystone commands.

Try bumping this from 1 to 4, as it may improve our CI runtimes.

Change-Id: I43b448ca5cbd54bfbfc632aa89a205f866b0fb5f

commit_message:
[WIP]: Horizon support for networking-sfc

This patch implements horizon CRUD support for below resources.
- Flow Classifier
- Port Pair
- Port Pair Group
- Port Chain

Outstanding Items:
- Remove horizon depedencies in existing files

[unit tests]
SFC dashboard unit test is run by 'tox -e py27django'.
This will be merged into py27 or enabled in the gate.

**WIP**: Some unit tests are skipped due to failures or
unexpected method calls. This should be fixed before merged.

Change-Id: I534c885e8b2d8996e383f60322f063bd51256033
Co-Authored-By: Masco Kaliyamoorthy <masco.kaliyamoorthy@enov.com>
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ramanjaneya Reddy Palleti <ramanjaneya.palleti@huawei.com>

While the configuration of how an instance is placed on the host is
documented, the specifics of how the inner topology of this instance can
be customized is not. Close this gap.

This includes an additional section to the introduction that details
what the terms "socket", "core" and "thread" mean in the context of
OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ia53bd81682f474271d284b3715887f42b29cf2b9
'}]
commit_message:
[admin-guide] Document CPU topology configuration

While the configuration of how an instance is placed on the host is
documented, the specifics of how the inner topology of this instance can
be customized is not. Close this gap.

This includes an additional section to the introduction that details
what the terms "socket", "core" and "thread" mean in the context of
OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ia53bd81682f474271d284b3715887f42b29cf2b9

subject: Use CoreOS 1068.9.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 16:13:08.000000000', 'files': ['imagebuild/coreos/version.txt'], 'message': 'Use CoreOS 1068.9.0

The differences between 1010.6.0 and 1068.9.0 are published by the
CoreOS team [1] and are noted below.

1068.9.0
========

Security Updates:

* libcurl 7.50.1 for CVE-2016-5419, CVE-2016-5420, CVE-2016-5421,
  CVE-2016-4802, CVE-2016-3739

1068.8.0
========

Security Updates:

* libpcre 8.38-r1 for CVE-2014-8964, CVE-2014-8964, CVE-2015-5073,
  CVE-2015-5073, CVE-2015-5073, CVE-2015-8380, CVE-2015-8381,
  CVE-2015-8383, CVE-2015-8384, CVE-2015-8385, CVE-2015-8386,
  CVE-2015-8387, CVE-2015-8388, CVE-2015-8389, CVE-2015-8390,
  CVE-2015-8391, CVE-2015-8392, CVE-2015-8393, CVE-2015-8394,
  CVE-2015-8395, CVE-2016-1283, CVE-2016-1283

Bug Fixes:

* Properly escape systemd specifiers (#1459)

1068.6.0
========

Bug Fixes:

* Fix parsing of the user database which caused systemd-sysusers to crash (#1394)
* Fix handling of certain unicode characters in bash (#1411)
* Fix issue when starting transient services (#1430)
* Include work-around for empty SSH host keys (#106)

Changes:

* Removed Kubernetes kubelet
  * The Stable channel has never contained a version which included the
    kubelet. If an instance was booted from the Beta or Alpha channels
    and then moved to the Stable channel, it will lose the kubelet when
    it updates to this release.
* Set group for /dev/kvm

Updates:

* coreos-metadata v0.4.1
* bash 4.3_p46

[1] https://coreos.com/releases/

Change-Id: I00c2114aeea9d4c1b8e38f5786158f248875970d
'}]
commit_message:
Use CoreOS 1068.9.0

The differences between 1010.6.0 and 1068.9.0 are published by the
CoreOS team [1] and are noted below.

1068.9.0
========

Security Updates:

* libcurl 7.50.1 for CVE-2016-5419, CVE-2016-5420, CVE-2016-5421,
  CVE-2016-4802, CVE-2016-3739

1068.8.0
========

Security Updates:

* libpcre 8.38-r1 for CVE-2014-8964, CVE-2014-8964, CVE-2015-5073,
  CVE-2015-5073, CVE-2015-5073, CVE-2015-8380, CVE-2015-8381,
  CVE-2015-8383, CVE-2015-8384, CVE-2015-8385, CVE-2015-8386,
  CVE-2015-8387, CVE-2015-8388, CVE-2015-8389, CVE-2015-8390,
  CVE-2015-8391, CVE-2015-8392, CVE-2015-8393, CVE-2015-8394,
  CVE-2015-8395, CVE-2016-1283, CVE-2016-1283

Bug Fixes:

* Properly escape systemd specifiers (#1459)

1068.6.0
========

Bug Fixes:

* Fix parsing of the user database which caused systemd-sysusers to crash (#1394)
* Fix handling of certain unicode characters in bash (#1411)
* Fix issue when starting transient services (#1430)
* Include work-around for empty SSH host keys (#106)

Changes:

* Removed Kubernetes kubelet
  * The Stable channel has never contained a version which included the
    kubelet. If an instance was booted from the Beta or Alpha channels
    and then moved to the Stable channel, it will lose the kubelet when
    it updates to this release.
* Set group for /dev/kvm

Updates:

* coreos-metadata v0.4.1
* bash 4.3_p46

[1] https://coreos.com/releases/

Change-Id: I00c2114aeea9d4c1b8e38f5786158f248875970d

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-24 18:52:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/pecan_wsgi/app.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/utils.py', 'neutron/auth.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Pecan support paste deploy configs

Current pecan uses pecan hooks to do what paste deploy does in the
legacy wsgi framework. This is correct way to do it but paste deploy
allowed specifying middleware via a config file.

Some deployments have custom middleware that is loaded via paste deploy
and with the new pecan wsgi frameworking using hooks, this will not be
possible.

Change-Id: Icdff16c9eec8d187392362409aabcb88ef12c3e3
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Pecan support paste deploy configs

Current pecan uses pecan hooks to do what paste deploy does in the
legacy wsgi framework. This is correct way to do it but paste deploy
allowed specifying middleware via a config file.

Some deployments have custom middleware that is loaded via paste deploy
and with the new pecan wsgi frameworking using hooks, this will not be
possible.

Change-Id: Icdff16c9eec8d187392362409aabcb88ef12c3e3

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-15 12:18:13.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/base.py'], 'message': "object create move session context manager inside try block

the session context manager should be moved inside the try
block so that the session is properly rolled back, see [1].
It's not really a problem in this case because the exception
is re-raised immediately in the catch block. But it's
worth to change it anyway, it's an anti-pattern.

[1] http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/faq/sessions.html#this-session-s-transaction-has-been-rolled-back-due-to-a-previous-exception-during-flush-or-similar

Change-Id: Id426a687658c113c0347919d83f03b0bbb752c05
"}]
commit_message:
object create move session context manager inside try block

the session context manager should be moved inside the try
block so that the session is properly rolled back, see [1].
It's not really a problem in this case because the exception
is re-raised immediately in the catch block. But it's
worth to change it anyway, it's an anti-pattern.

[1] http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/faq/sessions.html#this-session-s-transaction-has-been-rolled-back-due-to-a-previous-exception-during-flush-or-similar

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: Id426a687658c113c0347919d83f03b0bbb752c05

commit_message:
OVS firewall to use VLAN for ingress tagging

Matching on the VLAN additionally to the MAC is necessary
to unambiguously identify the destination port and network.

Change-Id: I0095b7443bb1514202177510aa13194671e1e984
Closes-Bug: 1593760

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-23 14:17:13.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/common/helpers.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-l3_load_type-fb06846251a003cd.yaml'], 'message': "Add l3_load_type for l3 agent scheduler

This is part of refactoring l3_agent_scheduler. When l3_agent_scheduler
uses the framework from base_resource_filter and base_scheduler, it
is possible to make l3 agent scheduler use one of multiple options to
count its weight. The LeastRoutersScheduler and AZLeastRoutersScheduler
can use this option.

Depending on the current report from l3 agent, the options of
'l3_load_type' could be 'routers', 'interfaces', 'floating_ips', or
'ex_gw_ports'. The default value will be 'routers', which is for backward
compatibility.

Change-Id: I5278db0fc9b744518174d3041689736d1cf82711
Partial-Bug: #1509046
Co-Authored-By: Aman Kumar <aman.kumar3@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Praveen Kumar <praveen-sm.kumar@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shiva Kumar <shiva.kum.m@hpe.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add l3_load_type for l3 agent scheduler

This is part of refactoring l3_agent_scheduler. When l3_agent_scheduler
uses the framework from base_resource_filter and base_scheduler, it
is possible to make l3 agent scheduler use one of multiple options to
count its weight. The LeastRoutersScheduler and AZLeastRoutersScheduler
can use this option.

Depending on the current report from l3 agent, the options of
'l3_load_type' could be 'routers', 'interfaces', 'floating_ips', or
'ex_gw_ports'. The default value will be 'routers', which is for backward
compatibility.

DocImpact: A new configuration option 'l3_load_type' is added.

Change-Id: I5278db0fc9b744518174d3041689736d1cf82711
Partial-Bug: #1509046
Co-Authored-By: Aman Kumar <aman.kumar3@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Praveen Kumar <praveen-sm.kumar@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shiva Kumar <shiva.kum.m@hpe.com>

commit_message:
WIP:Introducing request recording mechanism

Capture requests/responses to/from ODL. The reason of using
DB is for synchronization when there are multiple processes
each holding an instance of OpenDaylightRestClient.

Change-Id: I40d28f0cde44ae93fd47f40b5aea11870c005aef

commit_message:
macvtap: prohibit agent start when interface_mappings is not equal

On agent start, the interface_mappings configuration is validated
against interface_mappings from other macvtap agents. This
is achieved by an RPC call to the ML2 Plug-in. If validation fails
the macvtap agents exits with an approriate error message.

Change-Id: Icb338425410a96395d778eb2309d8ac9c73f7799
TBD: Release Notes
Closes-Bug: #1550400

commit_message:
Add priority field in FlowClassifier API

This patch lets the user to prioritize flows when multiple
FlowClassifiers are attached to a PortChain.

Closes-Bug: #1582238
Co-Authored-By: Pavel Gluschak <trustytwelve@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] macvtap: prohibit agent start when interface_mappings is not equal V2

On every agent state_report, all mech_drivers are called to validate
the agents interface_mapping against all interface_mappings of
existing agents.
TBD: If it does not match, return a new status value and terminate the
agent.

Change-Id: I1edf2ed763fc12a174518fa5f95518888abad2a2
Closes-Bug: #1550400

commit_message:
[WIP] macvtap: prohibit agent start when interface_mappings is not equal V3

A mech_driver config option defines the master interface_mapping.
On agent start, the agents mapping is verified by the all mech drivers.
If it's not equal the master mapping. The agent will terminate.

This apporach has the problem, that a reconfigure of the server config
is not recognized by the agent.

Change-Id: I8eb5ade0b1bdc6fb833fca9a4b04a1436f2a2bbe
Closes-Bug: #1550400

listener that has a mismatched protocol. However it creates the pool
object in the database regardless. This patch ensures that the database

Change-Id: If59ad2246ff44f88091fe27d6bdb1ec3ae2a11e8
