commit_message:
Cleanup pool db when protocol mismatch occurs

The lbaas-pool-create command fails as expected when associated with a
listener that has a mismatched protocol. However it creates the pool
object in the database regardless. This patch ensures that the database
is cleaned up in the case of a protocol mismatch.

Change-Id: If59ad2246ff44f88091fe27d6bdb1ec3ae2a11e8
Closes-Bug: 1556342
Co-Authored-By: Albert Vo <albert.vo@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated quota driver "ConfDriver"

It was deprecated in [1] since Liberty, remove it from neutron.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/179543

DocImpact: All references of 'neutron.quota.ConfDriver'
should be removed from the docs.

UpgradeImpact: Remove option 'neutron.quota.ConfDriver' for
configuration option 'quota_driver' in neutron.conf file.

Change-Id: I876b59f7bbedff238033f551aaf23ced5cf4a97d
Closes-Bug: #1593770

subject: Ignore: personal repo and branch test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 05:16:54.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/networking-ovn'], 'message': 'Ignore: personal repo and branch test

Networking-OVN use manager_option configuation for NB and SB

NB and SB dbs are handled by separate ovsdb-server processes. The
ovsdb-server proess manage dbs based on the schemas for OVN NorthBound
and SouthBound. These schemas do not have any Manager Options similar
to the Open_vSwitch schema. As a result, for e.g., the frequency of
inactivity probes sent to clients from the ovsdb-server cannot be
modified.

This patch addresses the above problem by creating independent
 "conf.db"s for NB and SB. The ovsdb-server process which handles
the NB will handle a NB_conf.db as well, ditto for the ovsdb-server
that handles the SB.

Similar result can be obtained by adding a Manager Table to the
NorthBound and SouthBound DBs as well. In such case there would
not be a need for a separate "config" database. I'm willing to
consider this solution as well pending feedback.

Sample Calls for modifying the inactivity probe timeout value:

ovs-appctl -t /usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.ctl vlog/set any:any:dbg
ovs-appctl -t /usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.ctl ovsdb-server/list-remotes

manager_ip=`ovs-appctl -t /usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.ctl ovsdb-server/list-remotes | grep ptcp | awk -F\: '{print $3}'`
manager_port=`ovs-appctl -t /usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.ctl ovsdb-server/list-remotes | grep ptcp | awk -F\: '{print $2}'`

ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock --no-wait set-manager ptcp:$manager_port:$manager_ip
ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock list Manager
manager_uuid=`ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock list Manager | grep _uuid | awk -F\: '{print $2}'`
manager_uuid=${manager_uuid//[[:blank:]]/}
ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock --no-wait set Manager $manager_uuid inactivity_probe=0
ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock list Manager

ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock --no-wait set Manager $manager_uuid inactivity_probe=5

Change-Id: Iecfd9bb78ee40438d2307a39aac5f2e0c9682817
Signed-off-by: Amitabha Biswas <abiswas@us.ibm.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore: personal repo and branch test

Networking-OVN use manager_option configuation for NB and SB

NB and SB dbs are handled by separate ovsdb-server processes. The
ovsdb-server proess manage dbs based on the schemas for OVN NorthBound
and SouthBound. These schemas do not have any Manager Options similar
to the Open_vSwitch schema. As a result, for e.g., the frequency of
inactivity probes sent to clients from the ovsdb-server cannot be
modified.

This patch addresses the above problem by creating independent
 "conf.db"s for NB and SB. The ovsdb-server process which handles
the NB will handle a NB_conf.db as well, ditto for the ovsdb-server
that handles the SB.

Similar result can be obtained by adding a Manager Table to the
NorthBound and SouthBound DBs as well. In such case there would
not be a need for a separate "config" database. I'm willing to
consider this solution as well pending feedback.

Sample Calls for modifying the inactivity probe timeout value:

ovs-appctl -t /usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.ctl vlog/set any:any:dbg
ovs-appctl -t /usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.ctl ovsdb-server/list-remotes

manager_ip=`ovs-appctl -t /usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.ctl ovsdb-server/list-remotes | grep ptcp | awk -F\: '{print $3}'`
manager_port=`ovs-appctl -t /usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.ctl ovsdb-server/list-remotes | grep ptcp | awk -F\: '{print $2}'`

ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock --no-wait set-manager ptcp:$manager_port:$manager_ip
ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock list Manager
manager_uuid=`ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock list Manager | grep _uuid | awk -F\: '{print $2}'`
manager_uuid=${manager_uuid//[[:blank:]]/}
ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock --no-wait set Manager $manager_uuid inactivity_probe=0
ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock list Manager

ovs-vsctl --db=unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/ovnnb_db.sock --no-wait set Manager $manager_uuid inactivity_probe=5

Change-Id: Iecfd9bb78ee40438d2307a39aac5f2e0c9682817
Signed-off-by: Amitabha Biswas <abiswas@us.ibm.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-06 10:15:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'Update metadata proxy when router interface add/remove

If enable isolated metadata for network, a metadata proxy will be
spawned for network with isolated subnets. After the network becomes
non-isolated, metadata proxy from router will provide connection to
metadata service, and metadata proxy for network will be useless.

The process will do no harm, but will have a load issue in large scale
env. Because every network is born to be isolated, every network will
have its own metadata proxy. After lots of networks connecting to
router, there might be many useless metadata proxy from networks, which
will cost the load of host.

This patch will spawn/kill network metadata proxy process, when router
interface create/udpate/delete. So the network metadata proxy will be
spawned/killed, when the network switch between isolated/non-isolated.

Change-Id: If7e91215b887d760a6b42bfe25fae3c0d6709992
Closes-bug: #1557002
'}]
commit_message:
Update metadata proxy when router interface add/remove

If enable isolated metadata for network, a metadata proxy will be
spawned for network with isolated subnets. After the network becomes
non-isolated, metadata proxy from router will provide connection to
metadata service, and metadata proxy for network will be useless.

The process will do no harm, but will have a load issue in large scale
env. Because every network is born to be isolated, every network will
have its own metadata proxy. After lots of networks connecting to
router, there might be many useless metadata proxy from networks, which
will cost the load of host.

This patch will spawn/kill network metadata proxy process, when router
interface create/udpate/delete. So the network metadata proxy will be
spawned/killed, when the network switch between isolated/non-isolated.

Change-Id: If7e91215b887d760a6b42bfe25fae3c0d6709992
Closes-bug: #1557002

commit_message:
Unify the AZ*Scheduler for l3 and dhcp scheduler

This is part of work of refactoring l3 agent scheduler. Since l3
and dhcp scheduler are using the same framework. It is possible
to unify AZAwareWeightScheduler in dhcp agent scheduler and
AZLeastRoutersScheduler in l3 agent scheduler.

This patch will move the logic of AZ scheduling to base_scheduler,
hopefully, other schedulers can leverage the new
BaseAZWeightScheduler to implement their own AZ scheduling.

Change-Id: I4d818de58d79eaa1a230960f89184f19f85b9107
Closes-Bug: #1509046

commit_message:
Add QoS supporting for floatingip

Add '--qos-policy' supporting for floatingip API to
limit the max egrees traffic of the VM
which port is associated with the floatingip.

Change-Id: I10782640829900289a77b240366d186501253582
Related-Bug: #1596611

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-24 20:13:16.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/neutron_common_flow_classifier_specification.rst'], 'message': ' A common flow classifier that can be used by Neutron features

 This patch documents the two approaches that can be
 considered to support the common flow classifier functionality.
 Multiple Neutron Stadium features need flow classifier functionality.
 Instead of each feature creating its own FC API, we should have one
 common FC API that can be used by all the features. Currently
 the features that need FC are: Tap as a service, SFC, QoS, FW, BGP/VPN.
 Common FC APIs should be a superset of FC rules used by existing features.
 The goal is to come up with one consistent way of defining the API and
 classification rules. Through this common FC API, each Neutron feature
 can define its own FC and then associate the FC instance with the feature itself.

 An approach will be chosen based on design comprehensiveness, usage simplicity,
 future extensions, implementation, upgrade, and performance complexities.

 More patches may follow up on design internals for the
 adopted implementation approach.

 Co-Authored-By: Henry Fourie <louis.fourie@huawei.com>
 Co-Authored-By: Igor Duarte Cardoso <igor.duarte.cardoso@intel.com>

Change-Id: I716822b8babd0c4338c2c33df51d0bbd60132de4
'}]
commit_message:
A common flow classifier that can be used by Neutron features

 This patch documents the two approaches that can be
 considered to support the common flow classifier functionality.
 Multiple Neutron Stadium features need flow classifier functionality.
 Instead of each feature creating its own FC API, we should have one
 common FC API that can be used by all the features. Currently
 the features that need FC are: Tap as a service, SFC, QoS, FW, BGP/VPN.
 Common FC APIs should be a superset of FC rules used by existing features.
 The goal is to come up with one consistent way of defining the API and
 classification rules. Through this common FC API, each Neutron feature
 can define its own FC and then associate the FC instance with the feature itself.

 An approach will be chosen based on design comprehensiveness, usage simplicity,
 future extensions, implementation, upgrade, and performance complexities.

 More patches may follow up on design internals for the
 adopted implementation approach.

 Co-Authored-By: Henry Fourie <louis.fourie@huawei.com>
 Co-Authored-By: Igor Duarte Cardoso <igor.duarte.cardoso@intel.com>

Change-Id: I716822b8babd0c4338c2c33df51d0bbd60132de4

The customer will get confused why the project networks can not be
advertised, so adding a warning to remind customer that the networks
should be in address scopes.

With the in-tree pluggable IPAM driver, IPAM rollback tries to use the
DB session after it has been rolled back due to an exception. This
driver doesn't need roll back, so fix this by adding a method to the

commit_message:
Avoid IPAM driver reusing a session that has been rolled back

With the in-tree pluggable IPAM driver, IPAM rollback tries to use the
DB session after it has been rolled back due to an exception. This
driver doesn't need roll back, so fix this by adding a method to the
driver signalling that rollback shouldn't be attempted.

Change-Id: Ic254789e58a8a51cd1aa943cb71de12410f4c0a7
Closes-Bug: #1603162
Related-Bug: #1516156

subject: Mask lxc-net.service for systemd
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-17 19:54:50.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_net.yml'], 'message': 'Mask lxc-net.service for systemd

On systemd-based systems, lxc-net is started whenever
lxc is started.  This is because lxc-net is declared
as a dependency of lxc.

We currently mask the service on upstart systems.
We are presently manually configuring the lxcbr0
on all systems, systemd-based systems included.

This patch will mask the lxc-net.service to enable
lxcbr0 to be brought up without error due to conflicting
lxc-net.service.

Closes-Bug: #1580766
Change-Id: I099cf638bbb8874ca45b815383de8588fecbe7b6
'}]
commit_message:
Mask lxc-net.service for systemd

On systemd-based systems, lxc-net is started whenever
lxc is started.  This is because lxc-net is declared
as a dependency of lxc.

We currently mask the service on upstart systems.
We are presently manually configuring the lxcbr0
on all systems, systemd-based systems included.

This patch will mask the lxc-net.service to enable
lxcbr0 to be brought up without error due to conflicting
lxc-net.service.

Closes-Bug: #1580766
Change-Id: I099cf638bbb8874ca45b815383de8588fecbe7b6

commit_message:
DNM: Debug state of image dir

I have a feeling I need to land a patch first that adds the qcow image
to the IMAGE_URLs list so that nodepool will start preseeding it on
the images prior to running the test. But I thought it would properly
fallback and actually hit the internets and download trhe image. This
patch just is going to print the state of the image dir so I can tell
what's going on.

Change-Id: I52caaa260541997481d0dfd0cf04539d54858083

commit_message:
Use from_environ to load context

Oslo.context provides a from_environ method that loads all the headers
from the auth_token middleware into the correct parameters and will let
oslo context provide new features in future.

Related-Bug: #1602081
Change-Id: Ie79ee8d5f40032777bf12b8798d64e9dc8141c9e

commit_message:

This is because currently we do not so they can be lowercase
or mixed case once they get to the validation call which then
will not look at the email or webhook addresses

commit_message:
[libvirt] Remove live_migration_flag & block_migration_flag

Both, live_migration_flag and block_migration_flag, are deprecated since
Mitaka and marked to be removed. This patch removes these two flags
entirely from libvirt driver.

Change-Id: Ie5a7438f7c216b78ae3997b94ae2bce1b58a0361

[{'number': 64, 'created': '2016-08-16 13:25:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/gabbits/basic-http.yaml', 'nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/gabbits/resource-provider.yaml', 'nova/api/openstack/placement/util.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/fixtures.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/placement/test_util.py', 'nova/api/openstack/placement/handler.py', 'nova/api/openstack/placement/auth.py', 'nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/resource_provider.py', 'nova/api/openstack/placement/deploy.py'], 'message': "Add support for resource_providers urls

GET a list of /resource_providers
POST to /resource_providers for a new one
GET, DELETE, PUT a single /resource_providers/{uuid}

Uses jsonschema to validate input when creating or updating.
A 'uuid' FormatChecker is added in the util module to verify
the format of uuids in request bodies. Note the lengthy comment
adjacent explaining its magic.

The olso_context RequestContext is subclassed to allow it to
be an engine_facade transaction_context_provider. A database
fixture is added to the gabbi tests to create and dispose the
placement database per each gabbi testsuite (i.e. each YAML
file).

A resource_provider_url is added to util.py: given a
resource_provider object, give the url, accounting for any
prefix in SCRIPT_NAME

With the addition of working endpoints, basic_http.yaml
is extended with more complete testing of basic http behaviors.

Tests for resource_providers are in resource-provider.yaml.

Change-Id: I799d839101af78b4d89aca175f647efc2b56c401
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for resource_providers urls

GET a list of /resource_providers
POST to /resource_providers for a new one
GET, DELETE, PUT a single /resource_providers/{uuid}

Uses jsonschema to validate input when creating or updating.
A 'uuid' FormatChecker is added in the util module to verify
the format of uuids in request bodies. Note the lengthy comment
adjacent explaining its magic.

The olso_context RequestContext is subclassed to allow it to
be an engine_facade transaction_context_provider. A database
fixture is added to the gabbi tests to create and dispose the
placement database per each gabbi testsuite (i.e. each YAML
file).

A resource_provider_url is added to util.py: given a
resource_provider object, give the url, accounting for any
prefix in SCRIPT_NAME

With the addition of working endpoints, basic_http.yaml
is extended with more complete testing of basic http behaviors.

Tests for resource_providers are in resource-provider.yaml.

Change-Id: I799d839101af78b4d89aca175f647efc2b56c401
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

In preparation of forthcoming handlers to be used in the placement

duplication/boilerplate:

* require_content: require that input for POST and PUT has a

commit_message:
Add placement API web utility methods

In preparation of forthcoming handlers to be used in the placement
API add two utility decorators that will help alleviate some
duplication/boilerplate:

* require_content: require that input for POST and PUT has a
  correct content-type
* check_accept: require that the client is asking, via the
  accept header, for a representation that the service supports

Change-Id: I385c36e0af1a8a785c02e21ba4efa6046cde6366
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-04 00:32:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_conf.py', 'nova/conf/glance.py', 'nova/config.py'], 'message': "Add the ability to configure glanceclient debug logging

It's currently not possible to configure debug logging
for glanceclient, it's hard-coded to warning level. It
would be great to be able to just change config and
restart nova-compute, for example, when needing to debug
issues with glance.

Change-Id: I964e40085b68561af48b476c82288fc84d02bcc4
"}]
commit_message:
Add the ability to configure glanceclient debug logging

It's currently not possible to configure debug logging
for glanceclient, it's hard-coded to warning level. It
would be great to be able to just change config and
restart nova-compute, for example, when needing to debug
issues with glance.

Change-Id: I964e40085b68561af48b476c82288fc84d02bcc4

commit_message:
Link enginefacade to test database provisioning

This is part of a series which allows enginefacade
to be at the base of database provisioning.

Test fixtures are not impacted here, however
the global "enginefacade" is used to generate
database connections in provision.py

Change-Id: I94753ca103851e3fd79c1c6c9773f57e311a0273

subject: Neutron bootstrap to create service/project/role
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-08-17 18:12:11.000000000', 'files': ['services/neutron/neutron-bootstrap-job.yml.j2', 'etc/kolla-kubernetes/kolla-kubernetes.yml'], 'message': 'Neutron bootstrap to create service/project/role

This PS adds steps to Neutron bootstrap process to:
create neutron-service-and-endpoint-admin
create neutron-service-and-endpoint-internal
create neutron-service-and-endpoint-public
create neutron-user-project-role

It also uses per service secrets so no password gets exposed
even on the rendering server.

Change-Id: Ic24aa471a56ad726c9322c674832def7ff550289
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron bootstrap to create service/project/role

This PS adds steps to Neutron bootstrap process to:
create neutron-service-and-endpoint-admin
create neutron-service-and-endpoint-internal
create neutron-service-and-endpoint-public
create neutron-user-project-role

It also uses per service secrets so no password gets exposed
even on the rendering server.

Change-Id: Ic24aa471a56ad726c9322c674832def7ff550289

subject: do not validate ancestry of tags for independent releases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-16 16:12:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py'], 'message': 'do not validate ancestry of tags for independent releases

Use the placement of the deliverable file in the _independent directory
as an indication that the deliverable was independent, at least for the
version ranges covered in that file.

Only look at the ancestry of a tag if the deliverable is not
independent, because in that case mixes of series will be included in
one file.

Change-Id: Ib12ec6c15d4fea811c87e77ae4356868a10961fc
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
do not validate ancestry of tags for independent releases

Use the placement of the deliverable file in the _independent directory
as an indication that the deliverable was independent, at least for the
version ranges covered in that file.

Only look at the ancestry of a tag if the deliverable is not
independent, because in that case mixes of series will be included in
one file.

Change-Id: Ib12ec6c15d4fea811c87e77ae4356868a10961fc
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Configure 'conductor/api_url' if its not defined in another place

It's temporary solution to configure 'conductor/api_url' parameter via
'ironic_config' provider till it will be implemented in 'ironic::conductor'
class of puppet-ironic project.

Closes-Bug: #1613644

Change-Id: I27467942525956a8f9f29c055bc2046afe78f236

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-18 17:14:46.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/common.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py', 'keystone/token/providers/fernet/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py'], 'message': 'Fix the username value in federated tokens

Currently, in both unscoped and scoped federated tokens, the
username value in the token is equal to the userid and not to
the value of the username in the external identity provider.
This makes WebSSO login to show the userid of the logged-in
user in the Horizon dashboard, whereas before it was showing
the actual user name.

This patch fixes the value of the username in the federated
tokens, which will fix the WebSSO issue as well, since Horizon
looks at the username value and displays that as the logged-in user.

Closes-Bug: #1597101
Closes-Bug: #1482701
Change-Id: I33a0274641c4e6bc4e127f5206ba9bc7dbd8e5a8
(cherry picked from commit 2042c955c81929deb47bc8cc77082b085faaa47d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the username value in federated tokens

Currently, in both unscoped and scoped federated tokens, the
username value in the token is equal to the userid and not to
the value of the username in the external identity provider.
This makes WebSSO login to show the userid of the logged-in
user in the Horizon dashboard, whereas before it was showing
the actual user name.

This patch fixes the value of the username in the federated
tokens, which will fix the WebSSO issue as well, since Horizon
looks at the username value and displays that as the logged-in user.

Closes-Bug: #1597101
Closes-Bug: #1482701
Change-Id: I33a0274641c4e6bc4e127f5206ba9bc7dbd8e5a8
(cherry picked from commit 2042c955c81929deb47bc8cc77082b085faaa47d)

commit_message:
Refactor SBusDatagram

This patch refactors SBusDatagram by introducing a base class for
all(Server/Client, Out/In) Datagram classes.
It also refactors FDMetadata, which is previously defined in gateway
module as RemoteFDMetadata, and make it a general module to manage
metadata about a file descriptor.

Change-Id: I5037b7ac03cba2a6d1309cc8570ebdaca4e68813

The related_href was used to parse out the bridge_mappings table.
Unfortunately, *how* you queried for the data identified what the URI
would be.  An earlier change to remove some host_uuid's ended up
malforming the URI and breaking the bridge_mapping logic.

Closes-Bug: #1612047

commit_message:
Fix bridge mapping change

The related_href was used to parse out the bridge_mappings table.
Unfortunately, *how* you queried for the data identified what the URI
would be.  An earlier change to remove some host_uuid's ended up
malforming the URI and breaking the bridge_mapping logic.

This change fixes how we look at the URIs to see if a SEA is on a given
VIOS.  This should be more reliable moving forward.

Change-Id: I98f76a44db0f61d3e8ed4d3204c1e086bfe00fab
Closes-Bug: #1612047

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-17 13:53:13.000000000', 'files': ['tests/noop/spec/hosts/roles/cinder_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/roles/compute.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_cinder/openstack_cinder.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/roles/cinder.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-cinder/openstack-cinder_spec.rb', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/roles/compute_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Configure privsep entrypoint for Nova and Cinder

When os-brick starts using privsep, it will need to know how to invoke
its privileged half.  Amazingly the name of the rootwrap executable
isn't anywhere else in the config, so the privsep default uses just
"sudo" (no rootwrap). Required changes: set the privsep command line
to use nova/cinder-rootwrap in nova/cinder.conf

Similar changes in DevStack:
 * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277696/
 * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280031/

Closes-bug: #1613754

Change-Id: Ie2af71ff5d5a45f105d3e0395adeb2f153abf3ce
'}]
commit_message:
Configure privsep entrypoint for Nova and Cinder

When os-brick starts using privsep, it will need to know how to invoke
its privileged half.  Amazingly the name of the rootwrap executable
isn't anywhere else in the config, so the privsep default uses just
"sudo" (no rootwrap). Required changes: set the privsep command line
to use nova/cinder-rootwrap in nova/cinder.conf

Similar changes in DevStack:
 * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277696/
 * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280031/

Closes-bug: #1613754

Change-Id: Ie2af71ff5d5a45f105d3e0395adeb2f153abf3ce

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-08-17 12:09:30.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'bindep.txt'], 'message': 'Add SNI support via OS packages

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: Icc352315a39d65af1c98039580ad23aad6476d85
'}]
commit_message:
Add SNI support via OS packages

Some Linux distributions, such as CentOS 7 and Xenial, have trouble
validating SSL certificates when using get_url with servers
that use Server Name Indication (SNI).

This patch adds those packages to the list of required packages and
uses bindep to install them in developer test environments the same
way that the gate tests install them.

Change-Id: Icc352315a39d65af1c98039580ad23aad6476d85

subject: Add conditional task for "localhost" resolvers in containers
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-17 05:50:35.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_cache_preparation.yml'], 'message': 'Add conditional task for "localhost" resolvers in containers

This change adds a check for a localhost resolver in the resolv.conf
file. If there is a localhost entry in this file the task will assume
all DNS queries will be forwarded on to the host machines DNS
forwarding service by using the gateway address of the host machine.

Change-Id: Ia7c61d29c64ce3deaa4e22fd8c433df78e16fb79
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add conditional task for "localhost" resolvers in containers

This change adds a check for a localhost resolver in the resolv.conf
file. If there is a localhost entry in this file the task will assume
all DNS queries will be forwarded on to the host machines DNS
forwarding service by using the gateway address of the host machine.

Change-Id: Ia7c61d29c64ce3deaa4e22fd8c433df78e16fb79
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 23:05:22.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Iedfa3d30f5944417d2f95ae8ad3c61957d8b277b
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Iedfa3d30f5944417d2f95ae8ad3c61957d8b277b

commit_message:
do not emit warnings for missing hooks

Add a flag to disable the default warning log messages in the
NamedExtensionManager and then have the HookManager pass False by
default.

Change-Id: I78c91bcfd8cd41929f25057791157f82eb4a3a50
Closes-Bug: #1611387
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Update define-the-audit-scope spec

This patch set suggest to use availability zones, host aggregates
as resources for audit scope instead of using Heat.
Also it gives some details regarding Work Items.

subject: Glance bootstrap to create service/project/role
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-08-17 13:30:39.000000000', 'files': ['services/glance/glance-api-pod.yml.j2', 'services/glance/glance-bootstrap-job.yml.j2', 'etc/kolla-kubernetes/kolla-kubernetes.yml'], 'message': 'Glance bootstrap to create service/project/role

This PS adds steps to Glance bootstrap process to:
create glance-service-and-endpoint-admin
create glance-service-and-endpoint-internal
create glance-service-and-endpoint-public
create glance-user-project-role

It also uses per service secrets so no password gets exposed
even on the rendering server.

Change-Id: Ibfa747cdd86f1cd09a43e7d121704414a47efbcf
Partially-Fixes: #1605693
PartiallyImplements: blueprint glance-kubernetes
'}]
commit_message:
Glance bootstrap to create service/project/role

This PS adds steps to Glance bootstrap process to:
create glance-service-and-endpoint-admin
create glance-service-and-endpoint-internal
create glance-service-and-endpoint-public
create glance-user-project-role

It also uses per service secrets so no password gets exposed
even on the rendering server.

Change-Id: Ibfa747cdd86f1cd09a43e7d121704414a47efbcf
Partially-Fixes: #1605693
PartiallyImplements: blueprint glance-kubernetes

commit_message:
Container driver

This driver exploits a Docker container as a share server instead
of a virtual machine. The container acts as a CIFS server
and shares logical volume attached to it. The volume gets created
simultaneously to the container on a host in a volume group
specified by the user.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I711813a2022d765ab7a70ed670e34f68f9cf1399
Implements: blueprint manila-container-driver

commit_message:
Adds the api-ref migrated RST + YAML files

With this email[0], you must migrate API reference docs into RST.

The conf.py and the tox environment are also cribbed from nova.

Still need to retain the install_command in tox.ini, otherwise the
api-ref job fails.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/093765.html

Co-Authored-By: Anne Gentle <agentle@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Amrith Kumar <amrith@tesora.com>

Change-Id: I411a6a6bf2a8bcf252a2a89454a40c93125da62d

commit_message:
Designate integration

added designate client;
added SelectDnsDomain step in Cluster Template creation form. This
step is available if we enable dns service. This step contains one
dropdown list of available dns servers.
Domain Name is not required field so if it's not selected then
a cluster will be launched without designate usage.

partial-bp: designate-integration
Change-Id: If3e994026d012b9b33d59c8477d6f2a892f61374

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-16 01:50:54.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/tests/test_doctest.py', 'setup.cfg', 'hacking/checks/except_checks.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Add optional H203 to check that assertIs(Not)None is used

...instead of assertEqual(None, ...) or assertIs(None, ...) and their
negations.

Apparently that's a thing that people want? At any rate, 30+ projects
have this bug marked "Fix Released". However, without a check to keep
them from regressing, there is a long tail of follow-up patches that
distracts developers and reviewers from addressing user-facing bugs. See
the following Nova changes, spread out over the course of a year, for an
example:

    If3824356ddf4e6e2d91f6bc2fbfa41946d8463cc
    I09f38e219931e0d7ad27f04861d1ebbc3b5e2c5f
    Iee1379b941f93388900e89388676000b845fc8fc
    I0d38a82e78fbe94657ab9a71c08422007843d179

    I406ea23b0e78f45f16306813e4111a95716cd6b0
    Ic8cb1192e001409d827c8da55fe536681895944b

Add a check for it in the interest of not wasting reviewer time or
having more code churn than necessary.

Change-Id: Iad65cb6399f4f933cbd9f503c88ce144387d39b5
Related-Bug: #1280522
'}]
commit_message:
Add optional H203 to check that assertIs(Not)None is used

...instead of assertEqual(None, ...) or assertIs(None, ...) and their
negations.

Apparently that's a thing that people want? At any rate, 30+ projects
have this bug marked "Fix Released". However, without a check to keep
them from regressing, there is a long tail of follow-up patches that
distracts developers and reviewers from addressing user-facing bugs. See
the following Nova changes, spread out over the course of a year, for an
example:

    If3824356ddf4e6e2d91f6bc2fbfa41946d8463cc
    I09f38e219931e0d7ad27f04861d1ebbc3b5e2c5f
    Iee1379b941f93388900e89388676000b845fc8fc
    I0d38a82e78fbe94657ab9a71c08422007843d179
    I9316c0b125aa87b6ebfa996a559c3551093ea711
    I406ea23b0e78f45f16306813e4111a95716cd6b0
    Ic8cb1192e001409d827c8da55fe536681895944b

Add a check for it in the interest of not wasting reviewer time or
having more code churn than necessary.

Change-Id: Iad65cb6399f4f933cbd9f503c88ce144387d39b5
Related-Bug: #1280522

subject: Manually specify from_dict parameters
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 9459, 'name': '.Haifeng Yan', 'email': 'yanheven@qq.com', 'username': 'yan'}, {'_account_id': 16051, 'name': 'Ronald Bradford', 'email': 'ronald.bradford@gmail.com', 'username': 'ronaldbradford'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 01:19:48.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_context/tests/test_context.py', 'oslo_context/context.py'], 'message': 'Manually specify from_dict parameters

The way from_dict is structured today means that it is virtually
impossible for a subclass to use it. The function looks only at its own
__init__ variables and then creates a class with them. If a subclass is
adding something to to_dict (they almost all do) then there is no way
for that subclass to add anything to the from_dict so that it is
correctly reconstructed.

This problem is solvable by the pattern of passing keyword args through
to the constructor and having from_dict add to these arguments if they
are not already present. This pattern is already used by from_environ.

This change also moves from an inspecting __init__ args to explicitly
specifying the arguments supported by from_dict. This will be required
to start doing debtcollector and parameter cleanup without breaking
compatibility in the subclasses where the values returned by inspect may
not be those we actually want to pass to __init__.

Change-Id: Id5d78c2dbf76741338982e8d5ba08b6ad432ec42
'}]
commit_message:
Manually specify from_dict parameters

The way from_dict is structured today means that it is virtually
impossible for a subclass to use it. The function looks only at its own
__init__ variables and then creates a class with them. If a subclass is
adding something to to_dict (they almost all do) then there is no way
for that subclass to add anything to the from_dict so that it is
correctly reconstructed.

This problem is solvable by the pattern of passing keyword args through
to the constructor and having from_dict add to these arguments if they
are not already present. This pattern is already used by from_environ.

This change also moves from an inspecting __init__ args to explicitly
specifying the arguments supported by from_dict. This will be required
to start doing debtcollector and parameter cleanup without breaking
compatibility in the subclasses where the values returned by inspect may
not be those we actually want to pass to __init__.

Change-Id: Id5d78c2dbf76741338982e8d5ba08b6ad432ec42

subject: Replace  assertDictEqual() with assertEqual()
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-08 01:47:04.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/unit/test_api/test_api_v2.py', 'designate/tests/unit/test_api/test_admin_api.py'], 'message': "Replace  assertDictEqual() with assertEqual()

In unittesttools, assertDictEqual() and assertEqual()
are implemented by using '!=' operator. But assertEqual()
can handle dict, list, set and so on.
So we should use assertEqual() to make the test simpler.

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: Ie6a8087c3d81d54f99a38b5950ac1834a51cb8d1
"}]
commit_message:
Replace  assertDictEqual() with assertEqual()

In unittesttools, assertDictEqual() and assertEqual()
are implemented by using '!=' operator. But assertEqual()
can handle dict, list, set and so on.
So we should use assertEqual() to make the test simpler.

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: Ie6a8087c3d81d54f99a38b5950ac1834a51cb8d1

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 22:41:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I76c46dd841663c2b6ac12115dc72fee06de2d6af
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I76c46dd841663c2b6ac12115dc72fee06de2d6af

commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Ic78f6edfc455287180e76d8e25b6cb9d0402fff2

commit_message:
VMAX Driver - QoS support for the VMAX3

Quality of Service is regulating the throughput/bandwidth
that you use in provisioning storage.  You might want to
ensure that your critical workloads get the best performance
possible, so you use Storage QoS to limit the throughput
to non-critical workloads.

Change-Id: I78c454692c4f7ddc7a5fa863205bcc68323bfa4b
Implements: blueprint vmax-qos

subject: Fix race condition when configuring the qemu save directory
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-16 23:56:16.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_compute_kvm_install.yml'], 'message': 'Fix race condition when configuring the qemu save directory

The /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save directory is not actually created
by the installation of libvirt-bin, it is created by libvirt upon
startup. So if libvirt is slow to initialize and this task runs
before the directory is created, then the next task:
"Check if the qemu save directory is empty" will fail with:
stderr: ls: cannot access /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save: No such file or directory

Change-Id: I0d035fa6b4eaedebb733fef2126fe9c4f63c2917
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition when configuring the qemu save directory

The /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save directory is not actually created
by the installation of libvirt-bin, it is created by libvirt upon
startup. So if libvirt is slow to initialize and this task runs
before the directory is created, then the next task:
"Check if the qemu save directory is empty" will fail with:
stderr: ls: cannot access /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save: No such file or directory

Change-Id: I0d035fa6b4eaedebb733fef2126fe9c4f63c2917

subject: Triggering validations and messaging
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-08-17 09:40:16.000000000', 'files': ['src/js/components/validations/ValidationsList.js', 'src/js/actions/WorkflowExecutionsActions.js', 'src/js/reducers/workflowExecutionsReducer.js', 'src/js/selectors/validations.js', 'src/js/services/MistralApiErrorHandler.js', 'src/js/components/validations/Validation.js', 'src/js/immutableRecords/workflowExecutions.js', 'src/js/actions/ValidationsActions.js', 'src/__tests__/selectors/validations.tests.js', 'src/js/constants/ValidationsConstants.js', 'src/js/services/ValidationsApiErrorHandler.js', 'src/js/constants/WorkflowExecutionsConstants.js', 'src/js/actions/ZaqarActions.js', 'src/js/services/ValidationsApiService.js'], 'message': 'Triggering validations and messaging

Validations can be triggered either manually by user or by dispatching
the RunValidation action. GUI is notified about validation progress
via Zaqar messages. The status of the validation is determined either
by validation output (when listing validations) or by Zaqar message
payload. format of both is equal, which makes use of those sources

Change-Id: I4f5813da1e4da98d904cccfd584d3458f2fd9f29
'}]
commit_message:
Triggering validations and messaging

Validations can be triggered either manually by user or by dispatching
the RunValidation action. GUI is notified about validation progress
via Zaqar messages. The status of the validation is determined either
by validation output (when listing validations) or by Zaqar message
payload. format of both is equal, which makes use of those sources
simpler.

Implements: blueprint validations-mistral-integration
Change-Id: I4f5813da1e4da98d904cccfd584d3458f2fd9f29

commit_message:
List Validations and Validation results

This change implements new Validations and Results listing based on Mistral
driven backend. Validations are listed using ListValidations Mistral action.
Results of the Validation are workflow executions of run_validation
workflows where input is Validation's name. Those 2 sources are combined
using selectors.

Implements: blueprint validations-mistral-integration
Change-Id: Icac754491a4198f529c599eff413bb85d8bb5014

subject: Ensure that the cache rebuild is fresh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 16:27:39.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_cache_create.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Ensure that the cache rebuild is fresh

Currently when a container cache is built, the lxc-create action is
forced to make use of the existing template cache, regardless of
the image age.

Once the cache is prepped, our cache replaces the upstream
downloaded template.

While this is good for the general container creation process, it
is important that when the cache is prepped it is using a fresh
upstream base. This prevents the collection of cruft, ensures that
packages implemented are up to date and that the image contains
what is expected.

Currently the cache prep ends up re-using the previously prepped
cache.

This patch ensures that a fresh upstream image is downloaded if
the existing cache has aged enough based on LXC's default
algorithm.

Change-Id: I687b7f62b3937277d3fee4739f75715e28c22f15
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that the cache rebuild is fresh

Currently when a container cache is built, the lxc-create action is
forced to make use of the existing template cache, regardless of
the image age.

Once the cache is prepped, our cache replaces the upstream
downloaded template.

While this is good for the general container creation process, it
is important that when the cache is prepped it is using a fresh
upstream base. This prevents the collection of cruft, ensures that
packages implemented are up to date and that the image contains
what is expected.

Currently the cache prep ends up re-using the previously prepped
cache.

This patch ensures that a fresh upstream image is downloaded if
the existing cache has aged enough based on LXC's default
algorithm.

Change-Id: I687b7f62b3937277d3fee4739f75715e28c22f15

commit_message:
Update the keystone WSGI application locations

This change will update the file paths of the keystone WSGI
applications so that keystone will run properly and not just
produce errors in the logs. The virtualenvs were the primary reason
for this bug, and this solution allows for the deployment of
keystone without requiring virtualenvs provided that they override
keystone_bin.

Closes-bug: 1586161

Change-Id: Iedf4c2651d304d3034be64c781a6daf7ab0b400f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Plug updated VIFs
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-17 05:49:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/tasks/network.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vif.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/tasks/test_network.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vif.py'], 'message': "Plug updated VIFs

A plug of a VIF does two operations.  It creates the client side
adapter.  But it also does a 'treat' of the VIF so that the neutron
agent is aware of it.

It is expected that when the nova compute boots up that all of the VIFs
get plugged.  Specifically so that they can be retreated.

As a performance optimization, the PowerVM driver did not run the
plug_vifs if we detected that the client network adapter was already
there.  However, this led to an issue.  The VIF wasn't being
re-'treated' on the nova compute boot.

This wasn't an issue, unless you had the I/O running through the VM that
the nova-compute was running on (like OVS or Linux Bridge).  If that
VM were to be rebooted, then the elements on the trunk adapter (like the
OVS UUID) are lost.  They do not persist via reboot.

This is the OpenStack design and specifically why OpenStack calls
plug_vifs on each compute node reboot.  This change brings the
nova-powervm driver in line with that behavior.

The biggest change is that the OVS will now set the UUID on the trunk
port and therefore the OVS neutron agent will finish its initialization.

Change-Id: I1fcd708a39f87282a77a8c8db75dcbbff83e4d4e
Closes-Bug: #1609497
"}]
commit_message:
Plug updated VIFs

A plug of a VIF does two operations.  It creates the client side
adapter.  But it also does a 'treat' of the VIF so that the neutron
agent is aware of it.

It is expected that when the nova compute boots up that all of the VIFs
get plugged.  Specifically so that they can be retreated.

As a performance optimization, the PowerVM driver did not run the
plug_vifs if we detected that the client network adapter was already
there.  However, this led to an issue.  The VIF wasn't being
re-'treated' on the nova compute boot.

This wasn't an issue, unless you had the I/O running through the VM that
the nova-compute was running on (like OVS or Linux Bridge).  If that
VM were to be rebooted, then the elements on the trunk adapter (like the
OVS UUID) are lost.  They do not persist via reboot.

This is the OpenStack design and specifically why OpenStack calls
plug_vifs on each compute node reboot.  This change brings the
nova-powervm driver in line with that behavior.

The biggest change is that the OVS will now set the UUID on the trunk
port and therefore the OVS neutron agent will finish its initialization.

Change-Id: I1fcd708a39f87282a77a8c8db75dcbbff83e4d4e
Closes-Bug: #1609497

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-17 09:25:01.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/netconfig/tasks.yaml'], 'message': "Restart netconfig task when vips were changed

Reduced Footprint workflow:
1) add node with 'virt' role to cluster
2) set RAM/CPU limits for VM what will be spawned on
   'virt' node
3) run 'Provision VM' task
     - 'virt' node will be provisioned
     - set of tasks will be run on the node(including netconfig
       task and task for VM's creation)
     - created VM will be registered in the nailgun as this VM
       is connected to admin network
4) add registered node with 'controller' node to the cluster
5) run 'Deploy changes' task

We have no acting 'vrouter' on step 3.2 and executing of 'hiera_default_route'
will lead to failed deployment due to broken routing('hiera_default_route' is
not included into SpawnVMs graph in nailgun).
'hiera_default_route' is executing on step 5 for 'virt' nodes, but, 'netconfig'
task wiil not be re-executed after it due to yaql condition.
I have add extra condition to yaql expressions for both tasks to consider
changes in 'vips' field.

Change-Id: I932faa7bb931bfad12af1a15785dd2f1b6e8eb7b
Closes-Bug: #1610236
"}]
commit_message:
Restart netconfig task when vips were changed

Reduced Footprint workflow:
1) add node with 'virt' role to cluster
2) set RAM/CPU limits for VM what will be spawned on
   'virt' node
3) run 'Provision VM' task
     - 'virt' node will be provisioned
     - set of tasks will be run on the node(including netconfig
       task and task for VM's creation)
     - created VM will be registered in the nailgun as this VM
       is connected to admin network
4) add registered node with 'controller' node to the cluster
5) run 'Deploy changes' task

We have no acting 'vrouter' on step 3.2 and executing of 'hiera_default_route'
will lead to failed deployment due to broken routing('hiera_default_route' is
not included into SpawnVMs graph in nailgun).
'hiera_default_route' is executing on step 5 for 'virt' nodes, but, 'netconfig'
task wiil not be re-executed after it due to yaql condition.
I have add extra condition to yaql expressions for both tasks to consider
changes in 'vips' field.

Change-Id: I932faa7bb931bfad12af1a15785dd2f1b6e8eb7b
Closes-Bug: #1610236

commit_message:
Run console on the serial port if required

This commit adds the ability to use IPMI SOL console when the nodes
provisioned with an option 'console=ttySx' or 'console=ttySx,speed',
where x is 0 for the COM1 and 1 for COM2. If speed parameter doesn't
provided so 9600 used as default. This feature can be used for the
bootstrap nodes too.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1544820
Change-Id: I210001c5692281add2439843f4ad69d65c8f6e17
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 39fe69492c50b10912cb131f6a4e2b5aa3caeaec)

commit_message:
Replace horizon default config with custom config

Ansible's template action supports replacing horizon default config with
custom config, it should only add with_first_found param to
config.yml to support this.

Change-Id: I45b8eed5b8d6c4d42672d99e41bc4eff7023a26f
Closes-Bug: #1570677

commit_message:
Make nailgun_syncdb not refreshonly

The `nailgun_syncdb` command is idempotent and have to be ran even
settings.yaml was not modified.

Change-Id: I20074be281d7f7c8100f31fecddeb925bacca38f
Closes-Bug: #1613874

commit_message:
Configure HAProxy to prevent 'Slow Loris' attacks

This change configures all HAProxy HTTP (Horizon and OpenStack APIs)
services with two new options:
 * The option http-buffer-request instructs HAProxy to wait for the
   whole DATA before forwarding it to a server.
 * The timeout http-request 10s option tells how much time HAProxy
   let to a client to send the whole POST.
Also, this change moves ssl-default-*-options to the main config.

Closes-Bug: #1594314
Change-Id: I01a07e325bc5b9df8c1ce31cd5ac8e36eb5d5859
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix admin_token issue in keystone-only.pp manifest

To fix bug #1582893 we have removed admin_token_auth middleware
from public/admin/v3 pipelines. It turns out that this change made
it impossible to use dockerctl check command in swarm tests, since
openstack util were unable to authorize itself using admin_token.

I have modified keystone-only.pp to temporary add admin_token_auth
middleware during puppet execution.

Change-Id: I00ad873cda454fcf062db3a383057ad12511922c
Closes-bug: #1602573
(cherry picked from commit e03d04d23db7eb8fee04a874b17975cd207f3442)

services with two new options:

   whole DATA before forwarding it to a server.
 * The timeout http-request 10s option tells how much time HAProxy
   let to a client to send the whole POST.
Also, this change moves ssl-default-*-options to the main config.

Closes-Bug: #1594314

commit_message:
Configure HAProxy to prevent 'Slow Loris' attacks

This change configures all HAProxy HTTP (Horizon and OpenStack APIs)
services with two new options:
 * The option http-buffer-request instructs HAProxy to wait for the
   whole DATA before forwarding it to a server.
 * The timeout http-request 10s option tells how much time HAProxy
   let to a client to send the whole POST.
Also, this change moves ssl-default-*-options to the main config.

Closes-Bug: #1594314
Change-Id: I01a07e325bc5b9df8c1ce31cd5ac8e36eb5d5859
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Implement tacker workflows

1. std.create_vnf for VNF creation.
2. std.create_vnfd for VNFD creation.
3. std.delete_vnf for VNF deletion.
4. std.delete_vnfd for VNFD deletion.

Change-Id: I2c16c771d468db58728218fcf94154796e955ebb
Implements: blueprint tacker-workflows

commit_message:
Implement substitution mappings

Add validation for substitute_mappings and a test example.
The substitution is responsibility of an orchestrator so
work needs to be done in heat-translator to translate
substitute_mapping in HOT.

Partially example of substitute_mappings is given in
the test/data/topology_template/subsystem.yaml

Refer to the spec section 'Using node template substitution
for model composition' and related sections to read detail
on the substitute_mappings.

The related heat-translator blueprint is
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat-translator/+spec/
nested-templates

Partially-Implements: blueprint tosca-substitution-mappings

Co-Authored-By: Sahdev Zala <spzala@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I7baadef4f0b4c7cd426f710f4c74c198d02bc030
Signed-off-by: shangxdy <shang.xiaodong@zte.com.cn>

commit_message:
Refactor the logic around use of floating ips

The logic associated with the use_floating_ips configuration flag is conflated
and needs to be refactored. Essentially, whether or not sahara uses a floating
ip for instance management should be separate from whether or not an instance
is required to have a floating ip.

Implements bp: refactor-use-floating-ip

Change-Id: I9f666e8f9f476f34a508198b271568db17548565

commit_message:
Switch cinder auth parameters to a new scheme

Upstream puppet is moving to use separate class for auth parameters
and we need to re-use it in library.

commit_message:
Automated configuration of rsyncd

Automated configuration (using custom graph feature) is added.
rsyncd.conf is configurated using Augeas resource in Puppet as
an elegent solution which doesn't interfere with existing
configuration by Fuel bootstrap.

It adds two Rsync section: octane_code, octane_data.

RPM spec is also updated to incorporate octane_tasks Puppet module
into Octane package and set Rsync up.

Untapped controller group is deleted from upgrade-db-orig graph.

Change-Id: Ia8ea7214b0b93f414d1de9b07a48e1602c0d2ae3

commit_message:
Change murano rabbit username and password

Currently murano rabbit uses same credentials that uses main cluster
rabbit. Although user for murano uses different rabbitmq instance,
better to use another credentials, that are different from main infra.

Change-Id: Id3ea0f95d0c2b6435a48d13c240944f9d9e3745f
Closes-bug: #1609355

This commit adds makes murano installed with devstack use

commit_message:
Use glare urls explicitly in devstack plugin

This commit adds makes murano installed with devstack use
GLANCE_GLARE_HOSTPORT for glare endpoints instead of asking them from
keystone. This would make murano honor glance-glare urls in case they
have been set overriden by GLANCE_GLARE_HOSTPORT in local.conf

Targets bp: murano-glare-devstack-testing
Needed-By: I16be39131fafee958fa6dba2765552bc71217dfa

Change-Id: I351b1e066a21b0eb1f3f9120cd36087618c90206

Quickstart sets the libvirt uri option for the ssh driver; However,

commit_message:
Persist ironic configuration changes

Quickstart sets the libvirt uri option for the ssh driver; However,
this is set in a way that is overwritten every time the undercloud is
updated. This commit changes the ironic configuration change to use a
supported medium instead, which is to use the hieradata_override
option. This then will allow us to update our undercloud without
issues.

Change-Id: Iff8bc6aaf629dd3027eac153578949a51d79d742
Closes-Bug: #1610205

commit_message:
models: move AllowedAddressPair model under neutron/db/models

This patch moves the module into the canonical place. It does it in
backwards compatible way, by leaving the model available under the old
location, only emitting a deprecation warning on access from there. In
the future, the old module will be completely cleaned up.

This patch also makes head.py file that is used to import and register
all models in the tree to import everything from under neutron.db.models
without explicitly naming each module. In that way, we can avoid the
need to import each new module with models as long as it's located in
the designated place. The file is a well known abuser in terms of git
conflicts, and it's better to avoid manual work.

Change-Id: I084031e6b3c8d9113cc6ee6e3967f0e1edaee0b5
Partial-Bug: #1597913

commit_message:
Modified Add Rule Form Submit Behavior

Added form_invalid function to handle an invalid initial form
submit with incorrect values.

Issue was brought up in bug #1576869 in the comments by
Yves-Gwenael.

When you add rule to security group with invalid value.
It will throw error. Fix the invalid input. Attempt to
submit the form and a "Danger" error will be thrown.

Change-Id: Ice8b5b2e2e52ecaeb39a935b2cf1de1c950b7bce
Closes-Bug: #1576869

subject: Allow direct download from jessie-backports
revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-08-17 14:16:00.000000000', 'files': ['bb', 'bb-parse-params', 'check-and-build-bpo', 'sid-list'], 'message': "Allow direct download from jessie-backports

This patch allows to download from official jessie-backports instead
of building packages. It also allows to add parameters to the ./bb
build backport package shell script in the sid-list file directly.

To test it, we're adding a download of pyopenssl, using:
pyopenssl --download-from-jessie-backports
in the sid-list file.

Change-Id: I9047129dd2bd14d38e0b0ebf5ebe31b78dc64770
"}]
commit_message:
Allow direct download from jessie-backports

This patch allows to download from official jessie-backports instead
of building packages. It also allows to add parameters to the ./bb
build backport package shell script in the sid-list file directly.

To test it, we're adding a download of pyopenssl, using:
pyopenssl --download-from-jessie-backports
in the sid-list file.

Change-Id: I9047129dd2bd14d38e0b0ebf5ebe31b78dc64770

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-15 21:59:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': 'Make simple_cell_setup work when multiple nodes are present

The current code assumes that there is only one node per compute host,
and thus will try to create mappings for the same host if that host
has multiple nodes (i.e. in ironic).

Change to a set so we do it only once per host.

Change-Id: I1619ece851a1a5c090eb70bdca90e396465e328e
'}]
commit_message:
Make simple_cell_setup work when multiple nodes are present

The current code assumes that there is only one node per compute host,
and thus will try to create mappings for the same host if that host
has multiple nodes (i.e. in ironic).

Change to a set so we do it only once per host.

Change-Id: I1619ece851a1a5c090eb70bdca90e396465e328e

commit_message:
Allow to modify interfaces of error nodes with error_type=discover only

If a node has error status, it's error_type attribute should be also checked
to make a decision if it possible to configure the node interfaces or not.

Closes-Bug: #1589881

Change-Id: I664a57eae27ddc255610e2b4d5238b3d92c9e802
(cherry picked from commit 420fe4d5169de6e5fb45b6aa818b06e07f7352c8)

commit_message:
Restrict container name in REST API layer

Docker only accepts container name as pattern
'[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_.-]', restrict it in REST API layer.

Closes-Bug: #1613204
Change-Id: Ie4c69761f81a3110c412114de1a10e0c1a0c4c16

subject: Honor default_interface OCC setting in create_server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-14 15:10:42.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Honor default_interface OCC setting in create_server

If a network has been configured as the "default_interface" in a
clouds.yaml file, then it should be used as the default value to the
nics argument in create_server. If a nics or a network argument are
given to create_server, that should, of course, win.

Change-Id: I278848f958a464daf2a5249084216b013698d62a
'}]
commit_message:
Honor default_interface OCC setting in create_server

If a network has been configured as the "default_interface" in a
clouds.yaml file, then it should be used as the default value to the
nics argument in create_server. If a nics or a network argument are
given to create_server, that should, of course, win.

Change-Id: I278848f958a464daf2a5249084216b013698d62a

subject: Validate config vs reality better than length of list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-14 14:46:41.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Validate config vs reality better than length of list

Configuration indicating that a network is external only needs to
validate in one direction. Namely, if you indicate that network a is
external, and there exists a network be that can also be inferred to be
external, that's fine. But if you indicate network a is external and we
do not find network a, that's a problem.

The previous test using list length was woefully inadequate for this
purpose.

Change-Id: I3e7ece26de23007d1b97a7b8a25c3db31b124e5f
"}]
commit_message:
Validate config vs reality better than length of list

Configuration indicating that a network is external only needs to
validate in one direction. Namely, if you indicate that network a is
external, and there exists a network be that can also be inferred to be
external, that's fine. But if you indicate network a is external and we
do not find network a, that's a problem.

The previous test using list length was woefully inadequate for this
purpose.

Change-Id: I3e7ece26de23007d1b97a7b8a25c3db31b124e5f

subject: Base auto_ip on interface_ip not public_v4
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-13 15:52:05.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_common.py', 'releasenotes/notes/use-interface-ip-c5cb3e7c91150096.yaml', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Base auto_ip on interface_ip not public_v4

Currently the auto_ip logic checks for a public v4 address to determine
if it should make a FIP. However, we have richer logic that provides
interface_ip that takes in to account IPv6 as well as configured choices
as to what the "default" network should be. That is what should really
be cared about - does the server have an ip that would be considered the
thing to connect to it on.

Change-Id: Ica1feb31cc3477c6336a749c88f4706efd20484f
'}]
commit_message:
Base auto_ip on interface_ip not public_v4

Currently the auto_ip logic checks for a public v4 address to determine
if it should make a FIP. However, we have richer logic that provides
interface_ip that takes in to account IPv6 as well as configured choices
as to what the "default" network should be. That is what should really
be cared about - does the server have an ip that would be considered the
thing to connect to it on.

Change-Id: Ica1feb31cc3477c6336a749c88f4706efd20484f

subject: Add tests to show IP inference in missed conditions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-13 15:32:55.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_meta.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Add tests to show IP inference in missed conditions

There was no coverage concerning floating ip detection on clouds that
didn't have floating ips at all, or even the OS-EXT-IPS extension.
Although the problem was fixed in the previous commit, add a test that
shows it. Also, add a test for Rackspace specifically, since it's
network stack is different, to ensure that shade doesn't break dealling
with Infra's gerrit server.

Change-Id: I0bad8c69fe456a171d51f477dd6a5f8fb7065f60
"}]
commit_message:
Add tests to show IP inference in missed conditions

There was no coverage concerning floating ip detection on clouds that
didn't have floating ips at all, or even the OS-EXT-IPS extension.
Although the problem was fixed in the previous commit, add a test that
shows it. Also, add a test for Rackspace specifically, since it's
network stack is different, to ensure that shade doesn't break dealling
with Infra's gerrit server.

Change-Id: I0bad8c69fe456a171d51f477dd6a5f8fb7065f60

subject: Move list_ports to using dogpile.cache
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-11 15:45:34.000000000', 'files': ['shade/_utils.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Move list_ports to using dogpile.cache

A new system is nothing without a good example. Migrate list_ports to
the async_creation_runner interface in dogpile.cache.

Change-Id: I3a26e63f736cd4fca30efe774fc96fa40b5b31c4
'}]
commit_message:
Move list_ports to using dogpile.cache

A new system is nothing without a good example. Migrate list_ports to
the async_creation_runner interface in dogpile.cache.

Change-Id: I3a26e63f736cd4fca30efe774fc96fa40b5b31c4

commit_message:
Create and return per-resource caches

As the next step in consolidating per-resource caching, we should
actually create more than one dogpile.cache region. We should only do
that if the resource is a thing we actually are going to cache (which
means it has a list_ method) Finally, we should return it if requested,
otherwise we should return the good old self._cache global cache.

Change-Id: Id0a5f65437a8bb4b911eddf54f14369d6b79d3fd

subject: Lay the groundwork for per-resource cache
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-11 15:45:34.000000000', 'files': ['shade/_utils.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Lay the groundwork for per-resource cache

There are currently two caches, the global cache, and the per-resource
batch operation caches. The global cache is managed by dogpile. The
per-resource caches are managed by hand. However, dogpile has a mode of
operation that is precisely what we do in our batched operation
per-resource caches by hand. So set ourselves up to have and use
per-resource caches.

Step one is to make the decorator accept an argument that it'll use to
look up the cache.

Change-Id: I4fbde2f4528aeaee5c23f0e1d1e4590090acb6ba
"}]
commit_message:
Lay the groundwork for per-resource cache

There are currently two caches, the global cache, and the per-resource
batch operation caches. The global cache is managed by dogpile. The
per-resource caches are managed by hand. However, dogpile has a mode of
operation that is precisely what we do in our batched operation
per-resource caches by hand. So set ourselves up to have and use
per-resource caches.

Step one is to make the decorator accept an argument that it'll use to
look up the cache.

Change-Id: I4fbde2f4528aeaee5c23f0e1d1e4590090acb6ba

commit_message:
Use oslo.db 4.7.1 in upper-constraints.txt

This release contains a fix that is beneficial for Neutron gate
stability, particularly to make grenade multinode job in Newton less
flaky due to exceptions uncaptured by oslo.db on the old side of grenade
cloud.

commit_message:
Add tests for component registry suite for vCenter

With component registry mechanism plugins can set compatibility,
incompatibility and requires between components.

Current tests implement automatization to verify UI representation of
components relations. They have to be run regularly on CI.

To run tests you need to export variables PLUGIN_RPM (path to
example-plugin rpm) and VENV (path to virtual env). Run with
`npm run component-tests`.

Closes-Bug: #1597710
Change-Id: I7a89272bf0d41e0c2b7cfa838c4c383d76f58433

subject: Disable locale stripping on centos
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-13 18:30:58.000000000', 'files': ['elements/yum-minimal/pre-install.d/03-yum-cleanup', 'elements/yum-minimal/README.rst'], 'message': "Disable locale stripping on centos

This currently fails horribly with build-locale-archive segfaulting (see
bug). Based on strace, this is caused by /usr/sbin/tzdata-update not
existing - which should exist since glibc-common is meant to provide it
(which also provides build-locale-archive). I don't have any other leads
so for now lets sacrafice a few MB in size of our images to get images
that actually build.

Change-Id: I63be6098fadfc662b6c38d1d35252d6ad1e3aa81
Related-Bug: #1600741
"}]
commit_message:
Disable locale stripping on centos

This currently fails horribly with build-locale-archive segfaulting (see
bug). Based on strace, this is caused by /usr/sbin/tzdata-update not
existing - which should exist since glibc-common is meant to provide it
(which also provides build-locale-archive). I don't have any other leads
so for now lets sacrafice a few MB in size of our images to get images
that actually build.

Change-Id: I63be6098fadfc662b6c38d1d35252d6ad1e3aa81
Related-Bug: #1600741

2) Adds a blurb about reading the release notes before upgrading, as

commit_message:
Bring upgrade documentation up to date

This makes a few changes:

1) Per documentation policy, lowercase project names ("ironic" and
"nova").

2) Adds a blurb about reading the release notes before upgrading, as
that's where per-version upgrade steps and recommendations are now
documented. Refers to the per-cycle upgrade steps in this guide as
"pre-release-notes" upgrade docs.

3) Adds a general upgrade process - upgrade ironic before nova, and the
steps to upgrade ironic.

commit_message:
Refresh some config files based on bug fixes

Change IDs I123be151fdda8037e62ba21600e63c45fdc90c8d and
Ie332236d6e11e0cb63114bc1c68c3a8691f1f1ae fix adding some missing config
options to be included as a part of the sample configs. We need to
refresh the configs to include those to be part of the latest sample
set. This commit refreshes some of the config for that purpose.

This change has been inspired while writing release notes here
If0b8b731c2a1a1c41fc612d506c350073d832efa . It was observed that the
bugs mentioned missing config opts in the sample files and have been
marked fixed. However, in order to make the release notes consistent
with that claim and to mention, as a part of the release notes, that
those bugs have been fixed, refreshing this has become important.

Change-Id: I534a0dc2d9f82ab70517cde12bfd40d4f5ae69e2
Related-Bug: 1568723
Related-Bug: 1568894

commit_message:
Add tests for component registry suite for vCenter

With component registry mechanism plugins can set compatibility,
incompatibility and requires between components.

Current tests implement automatization to verify UI representation of
components relations. They have to be run regularly on CI.

To run tests you need to export variables PLUGIN_RPM (path to
example-plugin rpm) and VENV (path to virtual env). Run with
`npm run component-tests`.

Change-Id: Ic9fe38f67f8dce660c6a89600d3753849ac4c695
Closes-Bug: #1597710

commit_message:
Fix Protection Plan Creation Failed

When we create a protection plan, it throws a exception like
"Unable to create protection plan". The reason is that python-smaugclient
has changed the return value of protection plan creation.
So it needs to update dashboard as well.

Change-Id: I1d12fae5c2172f822368ac2bd51b50a049221126
Closes-Bug: #1613689

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-16 11:22:10.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/prepare_node.sh'], 'message': 'Prime pip cache

This should prime the pip cache for the root user on the
nodes. Running sudo pip (system level install), uses the root cache.

We seem to actually have to install this software, not just use -d to
download it, to get it into the place we can reuse for later installs.

Change-Id: I576d9b0809b6255256f07bf75561716a449403ee
'}]
commit_message:
Prime pip cache

This should prime the pip cache for the root user on the
nodes. Running sudo pip (system level install), uses the root cache.

We seem to actually have to install this software, not just use -d to
download it, to get it into the place we can reuse for later installs.

Change-Id: I576d9b0809b6255256f07bf75561716a449403ee

subject: Disabled IPv6 privacy extensions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-17 04:19:21.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/install.d/99-disable-rfc3041'], 'message': 'Disabled IPv6 privacy extensions

IPv6 privacy extensions can cause issues by preferring a temporary
network over a public one. This preference may limit connectivity
in certain situations. An example of a connectivity issue can be
seen where the command ``traceroute6`` fails or misses all hops
while other traffic to a given domain with a "AAAA" record may
succeed. To resolve this issue the IPv6 privacy extensions have
been disabled.

Related-Bug: #1068756
Change-Id: If3bb0fd690673a6d93114e6aebddb5985344b437
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Disabled IPv6 privacy extensions

IPv6 privacy extensions can cause issues by preferring a temporary
network over a public one. This preference may limit connectivity
in certain situations. An example of a connectivity issue can be
seen where the command ``traceroute6`` fails or misses all hops
while other traffic to a given domain with a "AAAA" record may
succeed. To resolve this issue the IPv6 privacy extensions have
been disabled.

Related-Bug: #1068756
Change-Id: If3bb0fd690673a6d93114e6aebddb5985344b437
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add fuel-plugin-openstack-telemetry

The plugin will be responsible for deployment and configuration of
Telemetry services (Ceilometer, Aodh) to make it possible to use
InfluxDB and ES backends and Mozilla Heka as a processing egine.

Change-Id: Ide6b3fd06d99425a60bc3e5afd619f81ca544a93

commit_message:
Update Boostrap to 3.3.7 to fix deployment timeline popovers

Twitter Bootstrap before 3.3.5 didn't have 'inserted.bs.popover'
event which is required for deployment history popovers to work.

Implements blueprint ui-deployment-history

Change-Id: I1261f25f949913806ede4d9ddc2d59a0b6ff1e91

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-17 08:31:31.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/db/api.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/profiles/test_profile_base.py', 'senlin/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Remove garbage parameters at db layer

The 'force' parameter at db layer was designed for supporting

commit_message:
Remove garbage parameters at db layer

The 'force' parameter at db layer was designed for supporting
soft-delete a while back. However, senlin now has abandoned soft delete
completely. There is no reason to keep these parameters around.

Change-Id: Idc911e11f0fc8096b08e088a96fc0a42218c0694

commit_message:
Revert "Use certmonger for automatic cert generation"

This reverts commit faeed2494ed8b4512ac293a62007c1503a1f4961.

I believe this is breaking IPA during instance deployment since it can not verify the cert generated by certmonger.

Change-Id: Idc4cfa816413238cec5a0ac53b1dec17bb0c2f89
Partial-Bug: #1613088

subject: Disable rabbitmq cluster partition handling
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 14200, 'name': 'Maksim Malchuk', 'email': 'maksim.malchuk@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmalchuk'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-19 09:08:03.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.pp'], 'message': "Disable rabbitmq cluster partition handling

Cherry-pick 9e8834489e6caec1b7e640ae56d2fbf4bf2e3775 from master

Currently autoheal functionality is a subset of OCF script
functionality (autoheal is concerned only with network partitions, OCF
also handles all sort of cases where rabbitmq becomes stuck). But as
both of this functions cause stopping and starting of rabbits, it
results in unwanted interference - as we've observed in 1585128, where
it triggered bug in autoheal code.

Even if rabbitmq bug will be fixed, it makes no sense to use both
autoheal and OCF script (actually, when clustered rabbit will stop
getting stuck during network split, autoheal will be as good as OCF
script).

Change-Id: I38fbf6d50e9aed35f3c5e3bc1e17de7001304706
Closes-Bug: 1585128
"}]
commit_message:
Disable rabbitmq cluster partition handling

Cherry-pick 9e8834489e6caec1b7e640ae56d2fbf4bf2e3775 from master

Currently autoheal functionality is a subset of OCF script
functionality (autoheal is concerned only with network partitions, OCF
also handles all sort of cases where rabbitmq becomes stuck). But as
both of this functions cause stopping and starting of rabbits, it
results in unwanted interference - as we've observed in 1585128, where
it triggered bug in autoheal code.

Even if rabbitmq bug will be fixed, it makes no sense to use both
autoheal and OCF script (actually, when clustered rabbit will stop
getting stuck during network split, autoheal will be as good as OCF
script).

Change-Id: I38fbf6d50e9aed35f3c5e3bc1e17de7001304706
Closes-Bug: 1585128
